description:
Omg, wow I mean wow. Either it's been a long while since I had a cupcake or Cupcake Cove makes the best cupcakes ever.

I was walking back to work the other day and i happened to have a sweet tooth so I walked in and ordered a chocolate chocolate to go.

When I got to my desk I took a bite and my eyes opened up like I couldn't believe. I mean the cupcake was so moist and flavorful that after the second bite there was none.

A little pricey, but worth every penny.
author: Ahmed H.

description:
Super tiny corner store selling cupcakes and macarons.  At $3 a piece, the cupcakes do seem a tad less expensive than other bakeries downtown.  It will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth if you're nearby, but it's not necessarily worth a special trip if coming from farther away.

Red Velvet Cupcake: The frosting was squirted on to order.  This made a clear distinction between the cupcake and the frosting, whereas pre-frosted cupcakes have that thin soggy in-between layer.  I kinda missed that actually.  The taste was spot on though, with a creamy/tangy frosting and fluffy cake.

Strawberry Macaron: This tasted like fresh strawberries mixed into cream.  Like I could feel the texture of some strawberry seeds/pulp.  Macarons are good in general, but this one was particularly tasty.

Salted Caramel Macaron: Unfortunately, this macaron was disappointing.  For one, it was too salty.  But also, there was just caramel flavored cream, not actual caramel.  And that inner cream part was pretty bland.

Carrot Cupcake: I really appreciated the carrot shreds and plump raisins, the cake portion did indeed feel like carrot cake.  The frosting had been applied earlier.  It had a thin sugary crust with a cream cheese smoothness underneath.  A very fun take on the traditional carrot cake!
author: Adam B.

description: Cupcake Cove is an adorable little almost-window on the corner of Battery and Pine. I've gotten cupcakes there for work events twice and everyone has raved about them. They have great flavors and the cuppies are super moist. Everyone's been super sweet both times I've gone. My only complaint is that they say they're open till six but sometimes are not.
author: Guinnevere C.

description:
Delivery is a difficult thing to master in SF, no matter how close a business might be to the catering destination, but Cupcake Cove really came through for me when I needed about 10 dozen mini cupcakes for an event. They offer bulk discounts over a certain amount, so for about 9 dozen, it was about $135 including tax and delivery. There are many flavors to choose from as well, might I suggest getting the passion fruit if it's in season, it's so killer that you can smell the sweetness from a distance. They come neatly arranged in boxes so there will be no smushing en route. 

You should enjoy a large frosting ratio to cake because the frosting is very rich, thick, and sweet. They aren't messing around here with their frosting swirls :) 

Would definitely cater from again for either large or small events.
author: Alison A.

description:
This review is strictly for catered orders. I've put in several orders for office shindigs such as birthdays, farewell parties, and baby showers. These guys do a great job accommodating my decoration requests and communicate with me several times throughout the order process. The cupcakes taste consistent each time.

I like that the cupcake is ~moist~ and the frosting is not too heavy. Don't get me wrong - I love me a cupcake from Sprinkles too but those are way bigger and heavier! These are the perfect size and much cuter/easier than serving and cutting a cake at work. 

The price point is pretty fair as well at $30 per dozen -  more if you order special designs or fondant letters. I joked that they need to start a club card program of some sort because I would be MVP.

They charge a dollar for their big plastic bag if you are carrying out, but the bags are nice and reusable.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Amazing carrot cake cupcake. Delicious flavor, smooth icing. So good!
author: Asha S.

description:
In a tiny little show appropriately called a "cove" is this gem of a place. 
I popped by and grabbed a single white muffin cupcake with chocolate frosting and it was pretty good. Was it amazing? No but for the price ($3.25) which is good by SF standards I think it was deserving of 3 stars. 

Good spot to grab  a dozen for your colleagues , friends or just for you if you need a sugar "pick me up".

I like lists what can I say? 
When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun

34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description: Ridiculous online "ordering" system. I placed an order online for mini cupcakes and received a confirmation email with the subject line: TheCupcakeCove.com Online Order Confirmation. Turns out that despite this "confirmation" email, it wasn't a real confirmation and somewhere in the fine print it says that a representative will call to confirm. What is the point of being able to order online then? Being at work and getting a lot of spam calls, I didn't see the call. Went to cupcake cove to pick up my order for my significant other, only to discover that they cancelled it. Was forced to buy the subpar leftover cupcakes that noone else wanted, with no effort on their end to make this right. Will never come back.
author: Alex P.

description: Don't bother. Wish I could give them 0 for their customer service.  Would rather make my own cupcakes (and I hate cooking) than order from them.
author: Jessica B.

description:
I've come here twice to get cupcakes because I was just passing through and I always crave a good cupcake. 

I come here because it is a cupcake place in the FiDi, not because they have amazing cupcakes. They have a nice assortment of flavors from the basic (think vanilla, red velvet, chocolate) to the more unusual (think salted caramel and fruit flavored cupcakes). Though the cupcake is moist, and the frosting is ok, nothing about any of the flavors that I have tried really has blown me away. The cupcake prices also seem a bit high in relation to the quality.  

All the people that I have met that work there are extremely nice and efficient. I'll come here if I'm really craving a cupcake and can't find other cupcake places nearby.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
In all my years of eating cupcakes, most have suffered the same problem: not moist enough. Cupcake Cove understands (although Magnolia Bakery in NYC is still my favorite!). 

We've gotten these a couple times for office birthdays, and each time, the cakes have been very moist and light. A peeve I have is that they don't label the assorted cupcakes, so its a bit of a guessing game as to what you're getting if you didn't order them yourself. Apparently guava is a flavor (and I've probably had it?) but I just didn't know given the lack of labeling. The pumpkin one is especially good. While I'm a sugar fan, others didn't like how you could taste the individual sugar crystals in the frosting.

As for location, I'd literally walked past the shop (literally just large enough for the counter) every day to work before noticing it was there. Apparently they also have a buy 5 get 1 free deal!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Awesome cupcakes . Have 2 favorites red velvet and salted caramel. Too bad they get sold out quickly .
Around 5 to 6 they will most likely be sold out and also too bad they are not open on the weekends .
author: Russell T.

description:
5 Stars for Incredible and Responsive Customer Service

5 Stars for Delicious Cupcakes (regular and mini)

5 Stars for simply being an amazing pleasure to work with this week!

5 Stars for being beyond reasonably priced

Thank you for making today's event a success. I will definitely order from you many more times in the future!
author: A H.

description:
Omg yes I want all the cupcakes!! They are also hiring I would work for cupcakes and free parking. I love sugar . I have a problem.
The man working here is nice as well it is a very tiny shop.
Oh yea and the cupcakes are good
author: Kelly A.

description: The best cupcake place in sf downtown. Cute store. A lot options for you to pick. They do great customizations for your orders well! I ordered my wedding cupcake here with pink rose pedal frosting. They did great job on them!
author: Ziyu Z.

description:
Exceptional qualities:

Reasonably priced
Fresh cupcakes
Amazing flavors
Great customer service

I often come here to get cupcakes for client offices and they are a hit! Flavors are much better in comparison to Kara's and the prices are more reasonable as well.

Dropped my cupcake today and they so awesome and gave me another one at no charge. Really amazing customer service and managers.

Highly recommend this place.
author: Shirley D.

description:
Smack dab in the Embarcadero and surrounded by all these business buildings is the Cupcake Cove. Literally is a cove considering how small it is! I was enticed by the assortment of flavors especially the more fruity ones like the guava and pineapple. 

Just like many other cupcake places, Cupcake cove serves designated flavors on certain days. More particularly, the fruity flavors like Guava and Pineapple are not served on most days! In terms of the cupcakes, you must get: The Chocolate Caramel, The Black Bottom, and the Coffee Chocolate (Despite the semi bitter taste of the coffee). I wish the mint chocolate was better as the frosting was a little stiff for my liking. If you want to go on a day with a variety of flavors - fruity and chocolatey - I would suggest Wednesdays or Thursdays! 

My only problem with Cupcake Cove is the lack of flavor balance with their vanilla and more fruity flavors. The cake is not as moist as the others and wish the frosting complimented the cake better. Other than that, cupcake cove is great for the sweet tooth, especially with the Buy 5 get 1 deal for bigger groups.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
It was a pleasure doing business with John, the owner of Cupcake Cove, and his staff; they were very professional and courteous.  I placed a big order with Cupcake Cove for my 50th birthday party; I ordered red velvet, salted caramel and chocolate cupcakes.  The cupcakes were very moist and the frosting was delicious.  My guest and I enjoyed them, they were scrumptious!  Not only did they taste good; they looked good too!

John was very accommodating; I had specialty cupcake liners that I wanted my cupcakes baked in, and he was willing and able to grant my special request.   Before, I placed my order with Cupcake Cove; I had contacted another cupcake business in Berkeley who was not accommodating and their prices and delivery fee were not as reasonable as Cupcake Cove.

If you're placing a large order, Cupcake Cove offers a special deal for every 5 cupcakes you buy; you get the 6th one free.  This was beneficial to me; the savings was substantial.  I checked the prices at other cupcake businesses and their prices were much higher than Cupcake Cove.

My party was on a Saturday, and although Cupcake Cove is not open for business on Saturday's, John didn't hesitate to take my order.  He baked my cupcakes first thing that morning and delivered them to the venue where I was having my party before 12 noon that same day, as he had promised.   The cupcakes were packaged nice and secure in sectional boxes and stacked inside clear sturdy tote bags, great presentation!

I highly recommend Cupcake Cove's services to anyone. My cousin placed an ordered for her birthday party the following week, after seeing and tasting the cupcakes at my party.  

Thank you Cupcake Cove for a job well done; I am a satisfied customer.
author: Andrea S.

description: I needed cupcakes last minute and they really came through. I placed an order around 10 am for 24 cupcakes and they were delivered by 2:30. They offer a variety of flavors that you can mix and match. I will definitely be ordering from here again.
author: NaKita H.

description:
I popped in here on my way home from work to get half a dozen cupcakes for my dad's birthday. When I walked in they only had two cupcakes on display. I was bummed, told them I needed six and prepared to leave. They told me to hold on a minute and then came out and asked what I wanted. They went in the back and made up four more cupcakes for me. It was an incredibly nice thing to do. 

Bonus: the cupcakes were a big hit. I will definitely come back.
author: Danielle S.

description: I tried Cupcake Cove once years ago, and remember not being that impressed. Since we were walking by after lunch at Barbacco, I decided to stop by and try them out again. They are located on a corner in the Financial District, and it's easy to walk by without noticing if you're not actively looking for it. It wasn't busy around 1:30pm on a Friday, which was good since this shop is TINY. We had four people in our group and it was a tight squeeze getting everyone inside. There was a good selection of cupcakes left, and they were still baking more, so all the flavors were available. I opted for the Guava & Passion Fruit ($3, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=eEdaNC4g_1fz0pvdkoK9qQ&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg) since it sounded the most unique. This cupcake had very subtle flavors, but you could still taste the guava and passion fruit. However, the cupcake itself was a bit dry/crumbly, and the frosting was too heavy for me since it's a buttercream. Although I enjoyed the flavor of the cupcake, I don't think I would come back since I didn't love it overall. I believe they also charge you $0.10 for the cute cupcake holder, which kind of sucks.
author: Amy D.

description:
Loved, loved, loved these cupcakes!  They were so light and moist.  I bought 8 different flavors for a client's office and they all loved them too.  I bagged the chocolate one and it was to die for!

Will definitely be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Vikkie N.

description:
I think my office has a cupcake problem. Every couple of weeks, cupcakes just seem to magically appear! Last Friday, February 26th, we got cupcakes to celebrate the Oscars.

I shared a Chocolate / Chocolate cupcake with a coworker. The frosting was creamy and light, but I found the cake to be a little too crumbly and dry. I did only take the tiniest bite though. I'm not a huge fan of chocolate, but surprisingly I didn't mind my coworker picking this cupcake. It was light and not too sweet with subtle chocolate flavor. All the cupcakes in our box had a chocolate base, so I don't think Cupcake Cove offers a huge variety. From the reviews and their site, it looks like they only offer a vanilla or chocolate cake base.

I like that they offer cupcakes decorated for fun occasions such as the Oscars, but I'm more of a fan of fruity cupcakes. I wish they had more variety.
author: Elena N.

description:
I wanted to like this place, I really did. Boss told me it was a coworker's birthday yesterday. My coworker said she wanted cupcakes and this place was the closest. This place is very small. There's no room for sitting so you pretty much just order and go. I ordered 15 cupcakes. 3 of each: red velvet, coffee, mint, salted caramel, and vanilla. It wasn't until after I paid that the person behind the counter told me that I can choose an additional three cupcakes free of charge because of their promotion going on which was buy 5, get 1 free. Wish they told me earlier so I could've just purchased 13 and get an additional two of them for free. So for the free ones, i chose lemon. 

All of their cakes are either chocolate cake or vanilla cake. The flavor comes from the frosting. I got to try the vanilla and the mint. Both cupcakes were crumbly and fell apart once I bit into them. The frosting for the mint was overly sweet! I took one bite and had to scrape the rest of it off! It's a pretty big deal for me to say food is overly sweet because I have a HUGE sweet tooth. After I scraped off the mint frosting and ate just the cake on its own, it was so dry! The frosting for the vanilla was a little bit better: not as sweet but had an overwhelming buttery flavor to it. 

At 3 dollars per cupcake, I thought this was a pretty steep price. It wasn't anything amazing, just average. If you work nearby and want a cupcake to satisfy those cravings, then i would recommend this place. Otherwise stick to Kara's or if you're down for the drive to Palo Alto, Sprinkles is still my number one place for cupcakes.
author: Cynthia T.

description: First time here and asked for a cupcake to go. 3.25$ per cupcake was not bad, until I tasted it. Mint cupcake was not good. Cake was dry, as of days old. The frosting was hard all around. It looks cute but does not taste how it looks. Won't even finish it! Perfect example of a waste of money.
author: Cindy S.

description: Called a week ahead to get three dozen Christmas cupcakes. I had seen them on yelp and they looked adorable! The cupcakes were great! Yummy and a hit all around with my co-workers. So, why three stars? Pricing. They were more expensive than other places but guaranteed the time I needed them. I was also told it was $20 for delivery within SF. I believe it was $15 per dz x 3dz + $20 and my card was charged $72 with no receipt attached. If I wasn't crunched for time, I probably would have researched a little more or just used Postmates to get them for me.
author: Leina K.

description: Came in at close to 4pm and no cupcakes were displayed. LUCKILY they have them in the back and the staff immediately put frosting and sprinkles on them under 5 mins for a dozen. So happy with the service. I've had their cupcakes before and they are great!
author: R A.

description:
My coworker got a red velvet and a guava passion fruit cupcake from Cupcake Cove to try out. 

The guava passion fruit one looked promising since a lot of people seemed to be buying it. 

Cake batter wasn't horrible, but the vanilla was so overpowering. I didn't expect a plain ol' vanilla cake. I was expecting a guava or passion fruit flavor cake. The only part that tasted like anything was the frosting (guava). No passion fruit flavor whatsoever. 

Oh and get this. The frosting was sweet AF. I barely ate it which is unfortunate given that, that was the only part of the cupcake that had any flavor. 

This place is on a corner. Very small shop. Only about three patrons can fit without bumping into the walls so be careful. It never seems too busy here though so you shouldn't have any problems.
author: Dianna C.

description: My old company used to go here all the time for cupcakes. This place makes a very dependable cupcake and although it may not be Sprinkles, it is still pretty good. This place is strictly to-go, so be prepared to enjoy your cupcake elsewhere.
author: Kevin L.

description: I really like this little place.  This is my second time here and I ordered 3 red velvet and 3 black bottom cupcakes for $15.  Kinda pricey but (I was having one of those days where you just want a cupcake) still yummy.
author: Ashley K.

description:
We got cupcakes from here for work for my birthday and got the buy five get one free special.  I got red velvet, salted caramel, coffee, peanut butter, and mint.  

I liked the red velvet (cause it's red velvet) but I'd say the best one was the salted caramel (and my coworkers agreed).  The salted caramel had the best actual cake and it was very soft and moist.  

I think the presentation of the cupcakes could have been better honestly.  The cupcakes were okay and good, but not impressive.
author: Michelle S.

description: So many times I get excited about a cupcake place only to be disappointed. That was NOT the case here. The cupcakes were moist and the frosting was 100% authentic. Had the strawberry, chocolate and a taste of the banana. Two thumbs up!!!
author: Miriam C.

description:
I'm giving it another try. I know it won't compare to Sprinkles but maybe the cupcakes have improved.

Picked up four cupcakes at around 3pm: lemon, chocolate, coffee, and salted caramel.

I started with the coffee cupcake. It was a moist chocolate cake and tasted like it was baked today. Topped with creamy coffee buttercream frosting and a bit of chocolate sauce. A very satisfying cupcake.

I next tried the chocolate cupcake. Also moist with chocolate buttercream. Also a good cupcake.

My wife tried the lemon. She also found it to be moist and a fresh lemon taste.

Salted caramel...tried it the next morning. Not as good. The cake tasted of lemon to me. In my opinion, should have tasted of vanilla (especially with the salt and caramel). 

Overall, much better than last time I visited. I would buy here again.
author: Frank T.

description: After doing cupcake tastings at various other popular cupcake companies around San Francisco, we hired Cupcake Cove to cater our medium sized wedding of about 135 people. We ordered 400 mini cupcakes and they did a great job delivering and setting up the cupcakes on the stands we provided ourselves.  The cupcakes tasted just as amazing as when we did the original tasting, and we received so much positive feedback from our guests about them.  Thank you Cupcake Cove!
author: Jeff H.

description:
The cupcakes are priced very reasonable $3. But they are not amazing - they are fine - not super moist - or anyhing so special your could not make yourself from a mix. So you definitely get what you pay for. 

Not too many flavors - what I can remember is this: vanilla, chocolate, red velvet, chocolate cake w/strawberry icing, chocolate cupcake with Mint icing, coffee, salted caramel (and maybe 2- 3 others) 

It is a great/conveinent place to grab a bithday cupcake and a candle for a co-worker on the fly.

Nice and clean.
author: Amy W.

description: My favorite flavors here are the caramel sea salt and mint chocolate! They have special flavors that change in rotation every day. They also have a "Buy 5 get 1 free" special right now. No seats to sit here while eating.
author: Victoria T.

description: Great experience at Cupcake Cove! Got 72 cupcakes for student staffers today! Mint, Coffee, Peanut butter, Strawberry, Chocolate, Red Velvet, Passion Fruit and more! Great location and friendly staff!
author: Rhett B.

description: I work in the Financial District, and this is our go-to spot when we need something special for company birthdays or other occasions. They're always moist and delicious - my favorite is definitely their blueberry flavor, but you can't go wrong with any of them. There's a wide range of flavors, from fruit to chocolate to caramel, and the service is wonderful; everyone I've seen who works there is super nice!
author: AJ P.

description: Love these cupcakes. Fresh, moist, yummy, pricing is good. Perfect to order for events. I got 4 dozens of mini cupcakes for my son's birthday, everybody loved them.
author: Yulia K.

description:
Stumbled upon this tiny cupcake shop around work and was pretty happy with their cupcakes. I walked in to pick up two dozens cupcakes for a baby shower. They were able to decorate the cupcakes right away so that was great. They have plenty of flavors and I really like their salted caramel and peanut butter ones. They do have buy 5 get one free deal so it is pretty good. 

This is not the best cupcake I have had though but it is pretty good.
author: Athena C.

description:
Pretty convenient since it's across the street from my office. I like that they offer mini cupcakes, and when you order single ones, the box they came in is pretty great.

Had these ordered for a coworker's bday.. the decorations on top are pretty decent.

Not my favorite, but not too shabby!
author: Angela L.

description: Recently stopped by and bought 4 different  flavors. Coffee, Lemon, salted caramel, & mint. The coffee cupcake tasted like vanilla cake the one you can make with the box powder. There was no coffee flavor what so ever. The lemon was my friends personal favorite it had a lemon cream inside. The salted caramel did have flavor although the bread was dry. The mint tasted like a mint Oreo cookie. Overall these cupcakes are okay I've honestly had better cupcakes from Von's bakery.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I've always seen the cupcake cove on my way to work and honestly thought the name was cupcake love, but my mistake.  

The cupcakes themselves were pretty good. They were moist with a good amount of frosting on top but it wasn't too overwhelming. I think the part I was disappointed in was there was basically only 2 cupcake base flavors, vanilla and chocolate.  I ordered the guava and passionfruit and salted caramel ones and they both came on a vanilla cupcake base. Totally understand the business side of things but it would be so much cooler and tastier if the cupcake was flavored lightly and similar to the frosting. The two cupcakes weren't bad; I just think that chocolate belongs with salted caramel more than vanilla does so that made me a little disappointed.

Protip: guava and passionfruit cupcake.
author: Nina Y.

description: Devine cupcakes with excellent service, John( the owner) was absolutely accommodating and the cupcakes were a hit at my party! Would definitely cater here again for my next event. I ordered the chocolate cupcake with mango frosting and vanilla with cream cheese frosting both were delicious but the mango extra yum!
author: meL Z.

description:
"Cupcake Cove" sounds like a name given to cupcakes that washed ashore and were found by pirates.

Thought I'd try a second time to buy cupcakes for Blue Eyes, in an effort to impress.

What's more harmless, and inconspicious then a cupcake, right?

Even better, I could mask my fragile feelings with dozens of cupcakes, since I was throwing party for someone at the office.

So here I was with dozens and dozens of cupcakes, like so many cartoon hearts floating out of my chest, and I present Blue Eyes with a special strawberry cupcake.

And Blue Eyes says, "Awww..."

Which seems to be the reaction these cupcakes got for our party.

I can honestly say that I tried the following flavors:

Coffee
Strawberry
Coconut
Chocolate
Red Velvet

They were all good, and tasted like their advertised flavors.

Why not 4 stars? Because they were just good, and not deliciously addictive.

So if I were stranded on a cove would I eat these cupcakes? Yes.

Would I set sail for here? Nope
author: Jack R.

description:
Cupcakes are delish albeit a tad sweet. The cake itself is quite dense but not overly so. $3/cupcake and they have a buy 5 get 1 free. 

I usually see all flavors available despite the website saying otherwise.
author: Julie L.

description:
I don't understand this bakery AT ALL. 

I pre-ordered cupcakes to be picked up on a Thursday. I had to cancel the order on Wednesday - there was no mention of a cancellation fee AND because I expected the bakery to make my order fresh, I figured that the cupcakes wouldn't have been made by then any way. Shouldn't be a problem. 

I ended up being charged a $15 cancellation fee. Because I wasn't aware that this was going to happen, I called to bakery to see what the policy was. Apparently, I was charged because at the time my order was cancelled (on Wednesday) my cupcake order had already been made. 

"Oh! So you don't make your orders fresh on the day of." 
"Yes - we do."
"Then why was I charged?" 
"Because when you cancelled, the cupcakes were already made." 
"I cancelled on Wednesday." 
"Yes." 
"My order was for Thursday." 
"Yes." 
"So my order WASN'T made fresh..." 
"It was." 

SOMEONE please explain what is going on here. How can you say that my order was fresh if you made them on Wednesday but I wasn't supposed to pick up until Thursday? 

I'm not hard up for $15 - I just wanted to understand the cancellation policy and if the orders are made fresh. A simple - "Normally we do make them fresh but in this case, we made your order in advance" would have sufficed.
author: Nayomi H.

description: They were ok cupcakes. I have  had better cupcakes elsewhere. The cream was on the  heavier side and too sweet. Cupcake were average too. Nothing great! Will not go again.
author: Mist C.

description: The kind man (maybe the owner) saw me, a very pregnant person, peaking in the window at 10:20 AM - 40 minutes prior to opening. He welcomed me in and offered to frost me a cupcake from whatever was ready. I got a delicious carrot cake + cream cheese frosting cupcake the helped soothe me and get me through a stressful morning. Thanks for the big heart and cupcake goodness!!!
author: Kari F.

description:
Always delicious...my favorite is the chocolate strawberry...
Overall there is nothing crazily unique, but they have classic and yummy cupcakes. For the icing is the deal maker. The staff is ways pleasant too!
author: Imani T.

description: I don't have a ton of experience with cupcakes, or cupcakes in San Francisco.  When faced with the task of providing cupcakes for a friend's birthday get-together, I panicked when I saw that my work is within proximity to Cupcake Cove, Batter Bakery, Kara's Cupcakes, and Miette.  So, I did what anyone else would do in this situation: I went to what was closest to me, which in this case was Cupcake Cove.  Having picked up one or two single cupcakes for various occasions before, I know that there tends to be a fairly good selection at all hours at their corner shop in the Financial District.  My husband was a fan of the Red Velvet, but really didn't like their Carrot Cake.  For last night, I opted for a Red Velvet, Vanilla, Coconut, Coffee, Guava/Passion Fruit, and Double Chocolate cupcakes for my friends.  The general consensus was that the Vanilla, Coffee, and Guava/Passion Fruit cupcakes were the big winners.  I love their individually cupcakes boxes, and if you're planning on buying multiple, they have a buy 5, get 1 free option! These are definitely not "out of this world" cupcakes, but they're certainly priced a little better than Miette (which we all know to be delicious, but also expensive), Kara's and Batter (who has a delicious Sand Angel cookie but lacks availability for cupcakes at their Embarcadero outpost). I would definitely come back here in a bind, or until I find a better alternative in the area.
author: Lisa I.

description:
While the shop is easy to find, parking is not. IT'S A MAJOR PAIN TO LOOK FOR PARKING IN THIS AREA! Unless you're willing to shell out $3.50 per 1/2 hour to park in a garage, you're going to be driving around looking for parking for a while.

Coming in here, I wasn't really greeted by the worker. She looked at me for a second, but didn't say anything. That was alright, though. I was just here to get some cupcakes, use the 50% off from Scoutmob, and then go home.

I got a Black Bottom, Red velvet, and a Strawberry chocolate. Now let me just say, the black bottom was good. One bite in and you're hit with this GIANT chocolate flavor. The strawberry one was alright, but I think their cake to frosting ratio was way off. I had way more frosting than the cake! And since the frosting was really sweet, it really needed something else to go with it. Like more cake...? I gave the red velvet to a friend so I don't know how it taste.

However, if you want a cheap cupcake then go here. They look good ('cept the Black Bottom. The top was REALLY deflated!), but taste wise- they're only average. Definitely not that memorable.

Sprinkles is my go-to place for cupcakes.
author: Venus L.

description:
My bf ordered these about a week and a half advance for a surprise on our V-day weekend Napa trip.  His old co-worker told him about this place so she was able to pick it up for him. 

When he opened the box, of course I instantly loved them because...what girly girl doesn't love Hello Kitty?!  Next up was the taste test!  I LOVE LOVE That Takes The Cake, but this is my new favorite Red Velvet cupcake maker!  It's not overly sweet and not oily, TTTC's red velvet is oily.  What I love too is their frosting was harder, just like TTTC.  Finally, a second cupcake place that makes a harder frosting!  These cupcakes also keep well for several days.

I just wish that Cupcake Cove was in a more convenient location for those who don't work in the Financial District.  Bf & I drive out across town to Marina for cupcakes & that is a pain for parking at times, but the parking situation is harder in Fidi.  I would definitely stop in though if I'm ever in the area.
author: Cat C.

description: Soooooo great and moist and flavorful!! The bf and I tried the standard favorites vanilla and chocolate- both exceeded our expectations. Delicious!
author: mandy s.

description:
With a name like Cupcake Cove, how can anyone avoid the temptation and not want to dive right in?  Peek inside the tiny "stand" of a shop and see that they have beautiful little cupcakes lined up just for you to take home. Feeling especially special, I bought a red velvet cupcake to share with my Jenn-Jenn.  Half a cupcake is just a special little treat at half of the calories. 

They placed the perfect little cupcake in this tiny cupcake box, which I was so impressed by - I walked back to the office holding it like a trophy. Yeah, that's my cupcake. *bragging*

The best part, it was absolutely delicious.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Had a guava passionfruit cupcake here. Delicious. The frosting had a distinct guava flavor. The cake was moist. And only $3, too. Would definitely come back.
author: Dwayne J.

description: Ordered some cupcakes and they were all cute looking but taste wise so so. I tried the guava passion and there wasn't much to it. I was hoping the cake batter was more flavorful. The employees were nice (but may take 1-2 business days to get your online orders) perhaps going into the store or calling will get you quicker service. Nonetheless, it was delivered prior to the delivery time which I was happy about'
author: Ann L.

description: Looking for cupcakes? Then come to Cupcake Cover! They got plenty of different flavored cupcakes here for you to choose from!
author: Alice X.

description:
Mint.Chocolate.Chip

WOW. I bought the Mint Chocolate Chip and the Red Velvet for the boyfriend as a surprise. We refrigerated and forgot about them until about 12 hours later when we were in mood for a midnight snack. 

First bite goes to the Mint Chocolate Chip. Still moist and AMAZING after being in the refrigerator. Not too sweet, and the frosting is to die for...droool..... 

The Red Velvet was so-so--not as good as Teacake in Emeryville or Virginia Bakery in Berkeley. 

$3 for a cupcake but so worth it for that minty choclatey chip.

EDIT: Vanilla on Vanilla is amazing too! YUMMY! I'm def. coming back whenever I'm in the City!
author: Debbie T.

description:
So I really never heard of this place until I was at a friend's house and she just offered me some cupcakes. I tried 3 different flavors and yelped this place afterward to see which flavors I had just eaten. 

Apparently (according to the pictures/descriptions), I had half of each:
- vanilla frosting/vanilla cake OR a lemon frosting/vanilla cake (sorry I don't remember)
- guava/passion fruit frosting/vanilla cake
- black bottom

They all tasted really good! The vanilla one was very moist. The guava/passion fruit...YUM. I love guava and the frosting tasted like all guava (I'm not exactly sure what passion fruit actually tastes like...) The black bottom, I really didn't know what it was until I read deep into other people's reviews. It just looked like a cookie cupcake or a messed-up deflated cupcake. It tasted like a cookie on top of a brownie-like cake to me but now I know it's more like a chocolate cake with cream cheese and chocolate chips on it. It's pretty rich but it's definitely different and good. 

Even though I didn't buy these myself, they definitely made an impression on me. If only it weren't so far from where I lived. But if I was ever in the neighborhood or passed by, I would probably pick up a cupcake or two..or six.
author: Amanda L.

description: Yummy! They warm up the cupcake per order and then put on the frosting. Small space but great service and delicious cupcakes.
author: Stacey M.

description:
A dozen various flavors were sent to the office today and I had to restrain myself from gobbling them all up before they went to their rightful owner. They all looked beautiful and artfully crafted. I did get to sample the peanut butter chocolate cupcake--of course I'd go for the least healthy one--and it was divine. 

If I knew anything about this black bottom cupcake, I would've been all over it; seems like that's the way to go.
author: Adena B.

description:
My sister-in-law brought home half a dozen cupcakes including one vanilla with vanilla frosting, two chocolate with vanilla frosting, one chocolate and one vanilla each with coconut frosting, and one chocolate java. The cupcakes were visually attractive with a good cake to frosting ratio.  I HATE it when they pile on gobs of frosting!  

We cut them up so we could all try them. The consensus was that they all tasted good but were lacking in moisture; the cake was a little dry.

Personally, I felt that the cake part was a little bland, but the flavor on the frosting was very intense and it all came out even in the end.  The texture on the frosting was excellent, too, smooth and creamy.

I did not go into the store, but the box she brought home was very upscale and attractive.
author: Mimi J.

description:
I've come here more than a few times and bought cupcakes by the dozen. Typically come here because its closest to my work place and need a good cupcakery.

I always get great feedback on the cupcakes from here!! They're good and not too sweet (usually), but they are very clearly overpriced. I think if they weren't the only cupcakery around the area (walking distance), they wouldn't be as popular for sure. At $30 for 1 dozen, it's pricey considering the deals you can get off of Bloomspot or Living Social.

Anyhoo, LOVE the following flavors:
1. Passion Fruit Guava
2. Red Velvet
3. Black Bottom Cupcakes
4. Coworkers liked the carrot cake too!

Selection is limited, so don't expect 20 different types. Its a tiny hole in the wall too, so there is no seating (or standing area). You walk in and its the counter with three people crammed behind it.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Bought some cupcakes to go to give to my husband. While eating one of the cupcake, he noticed something crunchy on it. Turns out egg shells made it's way into the cupcake -  Gross! (Disgusted) Tried to tell the management and all we got as an answer was... "we literally cracked hundreds of eggs daily and it's bound to happen" No apologies at all! Very unprofessional. Are we just supposed to accept that? Never buying cupcakes here again and so as my co-workers after telling them what happened.
author: Nej Odaruj S.

description:
Not worth the $3. 

The first time I had a cupcake from Cupcake Cove (chocolate on chocolate), the first word out of my mouth was "meh". I thought the cake part was dry and the frosting was too hard. 

The second time I tried a cupcake from here (red velvet) I thought it was pretty bad. The cake part was again dry, but also didn't have much flavor. The frosting on that one was good, but there obviously wasn't enough to cover every bite of the cupcake so I ate just the top 1/3.

Today, I went to cupcake cove on the request of my boss to pick up some cupcakes for the office. At about 12:30 they were out of cupcakes. OUT OF CUPCAKES. Like, they weren't going to make any more for the day, they were just out. The girl working seriously could not have cared less and wasn't even remotely apologetic about it.

Just do yourself a favor and go somewhere else...
author: Rachel E.

description:
This place is a great hole in the wall and everything looks beautiful, but the taste just wasn't there for me. 

I got the guava passionfruit vanilla. I mean, the thought of that blend of flavors itself was enough for me to drool....but the frosting was so overly sweet, I just couldn't enjoy the cupcake. 

Granted, I grew up in an Asian family, where sugar isn't welcome, so my buds are pretty sensitive to sweet. 

The cupcake itself was moist, but not fluffy, but still a good texture. I think this place would be quite solid if it weren't for the sweet overload.
author: Annie S.

description:
They're ok. But not worth $3 a pop! Luckily, I've eaten these for free at work because of birthdays and stuff.

Nothing special. The flavors are kind of lacking, but I do like the fact that there IS a cupcake place in the FIDI and they have a variety of flavors. Hits the spot if you need!
author: Emily C.

description: My coworker brought me here and now I can't wait to go back. She said the red velvet was to die for so I bought that one and the guava passion fruit one. I ended up giving the red velvet to someone in my office who said it was literally to die for. I had the Guava one, which was a little dense but still very flavorful. The frosting was sweet but not overkill. Although they're not the best for my waist line I know I'll be back :)
author: Irma R.

description:
If you MUST have a cupcake in the middle of a workday or else you might have a meltdown or panic attack, then Cupcake Cove will take care of you. 

They have a good selection of flavors including:

sea salt caramel
vanilla / vanilla / chocolate
mint choco chip 
red velvet
peanut butter
coconut
strawberry
coffee
black bottom
GUAVA & Passion Fruit! I've yet to try this, but it sounds delicious! 

Pretty much all the popular flavors that you might be craving between 11am-6pm on a weekday. They also have an ongoing special it seems for buy 3 get 1 free. I like that their to go boxes actually have special compartments for the cupcakes -- this shows that they really care about the presentation of their cupcakes and preserving the frosting!

The frosting is nicely textured -- not too hard, not too soft, and the right amount of sweet. The cake is somewhat moist, but not as moist as Sprinkles. Each cupcake is a good size, and could probably be shared between two people if you wanted to try more flavors or just cut down on the carbs but still satisfy a craving. Sometimes they have a scoutmob or groupon deal, so lookout for that as well.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Our frequent 'staff recognition' dessert place, cupcakes taste great and look festive, less expensive than cakes. I liked their lemon cupcake the best, but haven't seen them lately.....did they quit making them?? 

I think I've tried all of them, the recent one with passion fruit frosting was good, too.
author: Yoko S.

description:
The teeny shop is cute and the cupcakes look nice. Don't plan on lingering because there isn't any place to sit. 

They have a frequent cupcake buyer card (buy 5, get 1 free and some double stamp days) and cases for single cupcakes that prevent them from falling over. It's rare to find a place with good carrying cases for single cupcakes. 

Flavors of the day: Black bottom, Salted caramel, Vanilla, Red Velvet, Coconut, Chocolate, Peanut butter chocolate, Mint chocolate, Strawberry chocolate

* Vanilla cupcake with vanilla buttercream frosting ($3): The cake was soft, squishy and moist. The cake was good. However, the creamy vanilla frosting was so overwhelmingly buttery and sugary that I had to scrape it off. Of course I've had plenty of sweet frosting that I can eat but this was inedible. 

I didn't see any mini cupcakes but a sign said they were coming soon). They also had 4 kinds of cookies (peanut butter, snickerdoodle, chocolate crinkle). 

Check their website for the cupcake flavor schedule.
author: Lolia S.

description: Cupcakes are a dying fad, and so is salted caramel, but yet I swung on by to indulge in a salted caramel cupcake after lunch. The cake was on the dry side, and the icing was good although almost too sweet (like, dry my throat kind of sweet). I don't know, these $3+ cupcakes have lost most of their appeal. Although, if you take it to go it comes in this brilliant little container that will protect it to the end of time (or at least through your BART ride home).
author: Natasha P.

description:
Moist. That's the way I like my cupcakes and the way cupcake cove makes 'em. I had the red velvet and it wasn't as deep of a red color as most places. Good because less food coloring that you're ingesting or bad because it doesn't look like a "real" red velvet? You be the judge. The frosting was not overly sweet like most places and has a lighter consistency, yet it is not too liquidity so that it doesn't hold it's shape. Love their individual plastic cupcake containers.

Overall = not too bad. Will visit again to try other flavors.
author: Linda C.

description:
I wish I could love them.  I wish I had enjoyed them.  I didn't.  

We tried these flavors: passionfruit/guava; red velvet; mango; salted caramel; vanilla; and black bottom.  It appears that everything is either vanilla cake or chocolate cake and the flavors are in the icing.  (Exception being red velvet, red cake.)  The icing while tasty, the texture leaves a lot to be desired, as it's not soft, whipped nor that 'memorable'.  The cake portions of the cupcakes were dry.  I'm not sure it's worth the $3/per cupcake.......      

Presentation = beautiful.  They had good carrying boxes for orders of 4, and single orders (individual case!)  

Service = mediocre.

Prices = $3/cupcake.  I used the ScoutMob deal, and saved 50% off of my order ($1.50 per cupcake.) 

This place is tiny, so don't plan on sitting down and gabbing.  Then again, I'm not sure I'll want to try them again unless they improve the quality of their cupcakes and work on flavor.  It's a shame.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I stopped by "the cove" the other day, again.  When I walked in I was greeted by the nice associate.  I ordered my cupcakes and when I went to pay the credit card reader was not working.  I told the man that I had no cash on me.  He said "don't worry about it, this one's on us, just come back."  

YOU HAVE A CUSTOMER FOR LIFE!
author: Des C.

description:
Working in FiDi can get drab real quick, but there's nothing like a cupcake to brighten my day.  I'll admit it.  My name is Liz and I'm addicted to cupcakes.

When Cupcake Cove first opened up, I didn't think it would be any good.  It was a tiny shop on the corner of Pine & Battery, for gosh sakes!  Well ... they've eeeeasily won me over.  This also is interesting since Cupcake Cove is competing with well-known Miette down by the Ferry Building (voted one of the top 10 desserts in America - by Food Network).  

But their cute little shop/stand gets straight to the point.  I've tried most of the flavors they've got in the store (I wasn't kidding when I said I was addicted to cupcakes) and man, do they know what they're doing.

My favorites would have to be - not in order: Peanut Butter frosting on a chocolate cupcake, Salted Caramel frosting on vanilla cake, Guava Passionfruit frosting on vanilla cake, AND... drumroll please ... Pineapple frosting on a pineapple cake.

I'm not a huge fan of sugary cupcakes.  I prefer mine to be moist, subtle, and nommy enough that I could eat two more if I wanted.  The best deal at Cupcake Cove is the Buy 5, get 1 free deal.  A half dozen cupcakes at $15 is a steal - especially with the variety of flavors they have.

To get your pick of the litter, get there before the lunch-rush.  Most people end up buying a ton of the more popular flavors, but otherwise, you're guaranteed to get a good one either way.  Also, this place is NOT open on week days. 

LOVE this place; wished they had a frequent buyers card!
author: Liz A.

description: Thanks to Grace L.,  I have been stalking the Cupcake Truck on Twitter. I had the chance to catch it other day when I was in the City Center. Unfortunately the rain kept me from finding it. However, I was lucky to find this little Cupcake Bakery. It is more like a closet and you can barely fit 3 people in line in there. Very claustrophobic once your inside, but if you overcome your fears;  you will be rewarded with these Sweet treats. The Cupcake Cove had a descent selection of Cupcakes given their size of location. I only needed one and the Winner was the Salted Carmel Cupcake. For $3.00 it was reasonable for this moist, not too sweet treat. Kudos for Cupcake Truck for re tweeting me, but this was the perfect place for me to satisfy my "Sweet Tooth". The guy behind the counter was also very nice. **This is review is for the one in City Center, DTW OaK**
author: Robert R.

description:
Not too impressed with Cupcake Cove.

Cupcakes are insanely DRY, frosting is not that great either!

For the financial district location, they're over-priced. They just seemed like regular cupcakes out of the grocery store.

And to top it off, they don't even sell MILK!
author: Tiffany F.

description:
$3.25 for a small cupcake! They shouldn't  charge this much when they're not as amazing as Kara's or Susie's.

It's a tiny hole in the wall place with two crammed people trying to sell you cupcakes. +The Red Velvet cupcakes are on the dry side.
+ their so-called "popular" Black Bottom Cupcake just looks terribly unappetizing.

They used to have a scoutmob 50% off but it expired when i got there and they didn't have any specials other than buy 5, get 1 free deal.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
I hate the word "meh", but it's so appropriate here.

I don't shy away from paying $3+ for a GOOD cupcake. But these cupcakes just don't cut it. The frosting is way too sweet and sugary (the grains of sugar crunch in your mouth as you eat it). The cake itself is okay. I think they need to do a better job at executing the flavors more creatively, and less in-your-face. Take the peanut butter cupcake for instance - the frosting tasted like pure peanut butter. It was just way too much. 

Their lemon cupcake is a bit more understated. But still, nothing to rave about. 

I say, take your $3 elsewhere.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Cupcake Cove is not a bad place to grab a $3 snack to satisfy your sweet tooth, but their selection of cupcakes is mediocre.  They have your vanilla, chocolate, peanut butter, and red velvet cupcakes -- standard flavors that I frequently make myself at home.  The only unique one that I tend to get a lot is their vanilla cupcake with guava and passion fruit icing.  I can just eat batches of that icing!  They publish their menu online, so you can check out their cupcakes availability before heading to the shop, so you can bet that on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays, this girl will be passed out in front of their store in a guava-and-passion-fruit-icing hyperglycemic coma (this is why I am writing this review on a Friday).

1 star off: could use more unique cupcake flavors
1 star off: Their frequent buyer program machine is broken probably indefinitely, so you are out of luck on that buy-5-get-1-free deal.
author: Ally W.

description:
I was Bryan K's buddy who was the blind being led by the blind...we were a bit dis-oriented (never lost) and happened to stumble upon this place...

For a "specialty" cupcake shop, it's not bad, but a bit disappointing.

Located in the middle of downtown San Francisco, located on the corner of Pine St and Battery St., the shop is a literally small, very small cupcake shop that you would overlook unless you see the cupcake sign above the store.   When my friend and I walked by, there were about six cupcakes available - two vanillas, two chocolates, everyone's favorite, red velvet, and another.  I chose the vanilla with coffee frosting and my friend chose the chocolate with cherry frosting.   Both cakes were a bit on the dry side - we purchased the cupcakes at about 1600 (4:00pm), but is should still have been moist.  Frostings were actually tasty - mine was not too sweet, and the coffee flavor was not overwhelming; my friend's cherry frosting was equally tasty and not too sweet.  

As stated, a bit disappointing for a specialty  cupcake shop - I am surprised at the ratings that others have provided.  I am in NO way a cupcake snob (that my friend and sister are), but through association with them, I have learned to enjoy good cupcakes...unfortunately, Cupcake Cove does not make them...or I just visited on a "off" day.  Apparently, reviews seem to be dependent upon the day - some days seem better than others.  We obviously visited on an "off" day...as Bryan stated, we took our recommendation from the "cute" and knowledgeable cupcake gal...
author: Mark N.

description:
The cupcakes are delicious however, the frosting is extremely too sweet.

The cake itself is moist and smooth.  It melts in your mouth.  Bite into the cupcake and you'll get and instant "sugar high".  The frosting is super super sweet.  I tried the peanut butter...its so sweet there was bearly any peanut favor.

If your cojnting calories,  definitely avoid!!!!
author: MickYee M.

description:
LIKE WHOA, LIKE WOW... YUM!!!
(4 stars)

It was worth a female getting her hair wet and frizzy for some delicious goodness. Some coworkers and I have decided to treck outside of our building on a rainy SF day to get some sweet treats, CUPCAKES!!!  

- cupcakes, moist + droolicious + sweet
- prices, $3 per cupcake (not too cheap)
- ambiance, as big as my cubical office

All i can say at this point, after the first bite

"Dear cupcake,

This may sound distrubring but you are SO amazing, i could almost make love to you. Okay not to that extent and i'm exaggerating. But you're yummy. I'd marry you.

Sincerenly,
elite yelp fan"

I only chose only one flavor while all the cupcakes behind the glass case were screaming for me to select them as if i went to a pet adoption place and the animals with puppy eyes waiting to be selected. I chose Lemon because all the others were like any other cupcake at other cupcake shops. trying something new....

LEMON - oh my goodness, did i just have a foodgasm. its been awhile since i've had one of those. the vanilla cake bottom was SO moist and delicious. the cream on top was a bit sweet and might be too sweet for those who dont have that kind of sweet tooth. vanilla cake bottom, light yellow sweet cream on top with yellow sprinkles drizzled and bedazzled on the surface for pretty perfection. great desert after lunch and a mid-afternoon snack to help make the days at the office go by faster.

Will I be back? definately will. i'd love to try the other flavors but Lemon was just fabulous.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Came here to buy cupcakes for a work event. Decent flavors but the cupcake falls apart. The bottom sticks to the wrapper and the top crumbles in your hand. Very amateur technique. 

Special: Buy 5 get 1 free. $3 per full size cupcake regular price. 

They have mini cupcakes but you need to order in advance.
author: CL S.

description:
This review is way overdue and late.

Rosario and V are freaking awesome!  

It was my first time going inside Cupcake Cove, which surprising is really small and they even do some of their own baking there!

I went in to buy a red velvet cupcake for a coworkers' birthday, and they were able to even write on small piece of icing a little message.  V was amazing enough to also offer me a cupcake on the house.  

Thank you for making my first experience such a good one!  Now I go there quite often to grab a cupcake to brightens someone's day because Cupcake Cove definitely made me feel special, even when it wasn't my birthday. =]
author: Mabel C.

description:
YUM!!! Each cupcake is $3, but if you buy 5 you get one free!

I tried the Chocolate with Mint Frosting and the Chocolate with Chocolate frosting. Both were equally delicious. I'm not a huge fan of mint but this mint chocolate cupcake really did take the cake (har har). 

I bought these during lunch, took them home, refrigerated them, and then ate them at 11pm. They still tasted excellent. The frosting wasn't overly sweet and the cake portion was super MOIST. Love it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It pretty much infuriates when people complain about the price of a cupcake being $3, it's a pretty standard/fair/competitive price.  You're really paying for the freshness, convenience and availability of the product. Aside from that note.

Parking - A definite NO-NO.  Definitely a quick stop from work type of place.  Really close to Montgomery Bart Station.

Cupcake Cove opened several months ago and has been consistently manned by nice and friendly staff.  I'm always greeted as I indecisively select the particular flavor of that days' cravings.

I've actually grown to be very peculiar about my cupcakes because (1) cakes have to be MOIST, (2) Crumbs are not my friends - I hate making a mess big enough for the whole world to see that I've been a fatty, (3) Frosting is too fat (too many calories that I'm unwilling to work off) - but I will tolerate a tad just to satisfy my sweet tooth.  With these three criteria, some of my notable favorites are:

Red Velvet - super moist, red dye cake with a super thick layer of cream cheese frosting (that I will only allow myself 1 mm).   

Black Bottom - ZOMG, byfar MY FAVORITE cupcake EVER.  No Frosting = Less Guilty Points.  It's a chocolate-y cupcake with cream cheese filling.  Almost like a chocolate cake and cheese cake combination.  It's like a stuffed donut, you find such a pleasant filling inside. 

I've also tried Mint Chocolate, Coffee, Lemon Vanilla, Chocolate Vanilla, Vanilla Chocolate, pretty much every flavor they have.  Most of these are just simple flavored cupcake with frosting as the highlight of that particular flavor.

Cupcake Cove has these REALLY REALLY cool single cupcake holders, not your conventional boxes that you have to make sure you wont topple on the way back to wherever you need to go.  Ahh, perfect for hiding in any purse.

After my numerous visits, I found out they do special orders!!!  For all you lazy planners out there - they can customize your cupcakes with Happy Birthday/Giants/Baseball/Hello Kitty decals or whatever your celebratory occasion may be but it does come at an extra cost.  Candles are also available for purchase.  Very cute/quaint shop, friendly staff, awesome flavors - Shhh, don't tell my boyfriend but I'm coming back for more.
author: Steph L.

description:
Kind of overpriced. Their cupcakes are the same price ($3.25) as Kara's, except only 2/3 the size. I usually like to try out cool, new flavors, but sadly since I went on a Tuesday, most of the flavors were some variation of Chocolate on Vanilla, Vanilla on Chocolate, Strawberry on Chocolate etc. I ended up getting the Carrot cupcake because it seemed the least plain of their small selection. It was pretty good - I liked the raisins in the cupcake as well as the taste/amount of cream cheese frosting. 

Overall: Good carrot cupcake, but I wish it were cheaper (given its small size) & I wish they offered a wider variety of flavors.
author: Kristina W.

description:
Um Yea, these cupcakes were fantastic! 

My awesome colleagues threw me a babyshower today and ordered cupcakes from Cupcake Cove for my babyshower. 

They were absolutely delicious!  The cake was moist and melt in your mouth deliciousness! I loved it. 

Will definitely need to go here and buy some more cupcakes. 

Loved it.
author: Christine P.

description:
I hope this corner shop isn't cursed because this place has turned over so many times in the last year or two. 

My first impression of cupcake cove is: Ooooo CUPCAKES!!!!!!

Yeah that's about it. 

Their vanilla and chocolate cupcakes are standard. I like the mint one the best and the one that doesn't come with frosting on top. I forget what it's called but its the chocolate cake one with some gooey filling. Kinda reminds me of my own homemade brownie cupcakes. You know, come to think about it, I probably like this because it doesn't have frosting. I'm not a fan of frosting but I am a big fan of cupcakes. It's weird because everyone I know eats cupcakes for the frosting, not the cake. Are you like that too? 

I suppose another $3 per cupcake joint is what San Francisco needs to boost the economy. I'm not sure if they still have their buy 3 get 1 free deal.
author: Heidi C.

description:
I bought a chocolate chocolate cupcake (basically a chocolate cake with chocolate frosting and chocolate chips).  The cake was very moist.  Overall it was yummy.

Deduct one star because of the steep price $3.  Yes they have to pay the rent and their employees but it was a bit steep for an average sized cupcake.

Not sure if I would come here often but they aren't bad.
author: Wendy H.

description:
This is a small storefront made for ordering to go. They have a variety of flavors and they're reasonably priced at $3 per cupcake, which is pretty standard for SF. They're good though they won't blow you away. The presentation is a bit simple too and has more of a homemade look. Out of the flavors I've tried I like the salted caramel and coffee. Today I tried a chocolate chip cookie. It had a good amount of chocolate and had crispy edges, but the middle was way too cakey. At $1.75 it was fine to satisfy my craving, but in the future I'd rather go to specialties for my cookies.

This isn't a place I'd go out of my way to try, but it's decent. If I worked closer I would probably go every now and then and just stick to certain flavors. It's also nice they have specials like today's was buy 5 get one free. Defintely a good deal if you're ordering a bunch for a party or your office.
author: Alice J.

description:
I have qualms about paying $3 for a cupcake that I can easily make myself out of a box (and it would probably cost the same.. for 2 dozen of them).

But then, they definitely wouldn't be as good as the ones I just had from Cupcake Cove.

Amidst the hustle, bustle, and general madness of the Giants' parade today, Cupcake Cove opened in place of the former Savory Crust.  I walked in this afternoon to see two types of cupcakes (red velvet and chocolate with vanilla frosting) and four types of cookies (chocolate chip, snickerdoodle, double chocolate, and what I assume is peanut butter).  The shop is very, very small and it was run by two sweet Asian girls.

They had a "Giants Special," which was Buy 2 Get 1 Free Cupcakes and Buy 1 Get 1 Free Cookies.  Not sure how long this will last, but I decided to take three cupcakes and two chocolate chip cookies.  A regular cupcake is $3, and a cookie is $1.75.

First, the cupcakes: the red velvet is effing amazing.  I've never had a better red velvet cake, hands down.  This beats Batter Bakery by a million yards.  It was a good size, with just enough cream cheese frosting (and when I say this is cream cheese frosting, it really IS cream cheese frosting, not some half-assed vanilla-cream-cheese crap that some bakeries put on) and an incredibly soft, fluffy, moist cake.

I wasn't a fan of the chocolate cupcake, but that's because I'm not a huge fan of too much chocolate.  The cake was also really fluffy and moist (but not crumbly), but with the vanilla icing and clear sugar sprinkles, it was entirely too sweet for me.  It's a good one for chocolate lovers though, I think, as the cake is dark and rich.

The cookies are about 4-5 inches in diameter, and they're the thin, chewy kind that are only about a centimeter, at most, in height.  The edges are slightly crispy, and the interior is really dense, not too sweet, and just plain bomb.  Their cookies are currently battling Bumzy's for the top spot in my cookie list.
author: Tori S.

description:
When your manager says "my friend is coming to drop off a dozen cupcakes to us", what do you do?

Nothing. You put your face into one of the coffee crunch cupcakes and sit back and relax for the rest of the work day. Granted that the "I should be working" moment has to pass after that, but why should it when you have these delectably delicious cupcakes right in your kitchen.

The cake is soft and moist. The frosting is the best part. Not too heavy not too light. Peanut butter, red velvet, coffee crunch, cream cheese.....mmmm. 

$3 is not expensive compared to Kara's or American cupcake. It's actually cheaper. Kara's is $3.25. And if you are going to have a gourmet cupcake be prepared to pay the price for yummy goodness.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I agree with anyone who said they are OK. I would consider myself a fan because they are a couple doors down and it beats a packaged cookie. The frosting is definitely delicious. Smooth and piped on top. The cake however is definitely light but that makes me skeptical. Cake is supposed to be somewhat dense. They are not very moist either. They seem to be little speckles of cake when you pull on it. (Hard to describe) That makes me think they have a lot of chemicals and it's some kind of GMO batter. Still. It does hit the spot.
author: Rayca R.

description:
Cupcake Cove is to Black Bottom as Sprinkles is to Red Velvet

Apologies for the bad analogy, but you know how certain establishments are just known for that ONE thing that you absolutely HAVE to order? Well at Cupcake Cove, I'd say the Black Bottom Cupcake is their "thing"...their claim to fame, so to speak. 

I'm not really one for cupcakes but uhh......I JUST ATE 3.
author: Denise L.

description:
Got the coffee cupcake after lunch today!  The presentation of the cupcake was nice and pretty but the cake did not taste fresh at all :-(

The cake was so dry and the edges were hard.  The cake itself was too sweet to me.  Although the coffee frosting was good with the crunchiness but again it was VERY sweet.  It was too sweet to taste any coffee flavor...only sugar!  

Maybe I should just stick with their popular Red Velvet!
author: Liza T.

description: The cupcakes were yummy but the customer service wasn't.  Not even a hi, bye or smile was provided after I made my purchase.  Lighten up,  after all, your selling a small piece of happiness to customers!  Geez...
author: Jenny T.

description:
Four stars only because my heart still belongs to Moonbabycakes, and there is a taaaaad bit too much frosting to cake.  But if ever I'm hankering for a cupcake while at work, I'm hauling ass to Cupcake Cove.

I don't understand the Yelpers who are disappointed with the price ($3 per cupcake) and/or size of the cupcakes here.  Trust me, the price and size are competitive to all cupcakeries around.  Over the past couple of years, I've certainly had much greater than my fair share of cupcakes, and I can tell you that Cupcake Cove ranks high above the majority (for a while I had even contemplated ending my cupcake expedition of necessary visits to every cupcakery within a 5 mile radius of me at all times because no one could compare to my ultimate fav, so why waste the green and, perhaps more importantly, the calories on new places?). Cupcake Cove lands likely within my top three cupcakeries, and I am so thankful to have gotten my grubby hands on an entire dozen (thanks so much, H!).  Fav of the bunch was def the Red Velvet; I was definitely impressed with how moist the cake was.

Cupcake Cove's shop itself is pretty much the size of my closet - blink, and you just might miss it. Service is sweet (sorry, couldn't resist), and I'll certainly be returning soon.
author: Mel T.

description:
Sweet Cupcakes

What's to like?
1.  Cupcakes!  - I think cupcakes are great.  I bought four for a meeting.  I had the red velvet cupcake.  I liked it.  It was a moist cupcake.  Folks seemed to like them too.  Sure, they are sweet.  They are a cupcakes.  I have a sweet tooth though.
2.  Friendly service
3.  Fast service
4.  Location very close to my office.

What's not to like?
1.  I like big cupcakes.  Their cupcakes are only medium.
2.  Their cupcakes are good.  But, since they are a cupcake place, I would expect them to be exceptional.  There really isn't anything to make them stand out from other cupcakes.
author: Mark D.

description:
First of all - I've had Cupcake Cove several times from work and they're just delicious. 

This is the first time I've ordered from them. They were super super nice, very customer service oriented. Totally able to fit in my custom order in the morning and have it done by 3pm that day. John was just stellar. Will definitely be ordering from them again!
author: Jessibo C.

description: The cupcakes are to die for! Definitely try the red velvet, mint, and peanut butter! The price is a little steep per cupcake, but as a once-in-a-while treat it is definitely worth the price!
author: Daphne W.

description:
2.5 stars just because I'm a cupcake snob. Cupcake Cove has a really small store front that sells several flavors a day (about 6 flavors?), so limited. The flavors aren't very unique either, so nothing that "gourmet". In addition, they have this deal going on where it's buy 5 get 1 free, at $3 a piece - so $15 for half dozen. 

I tried the vanilla cupcake and it was okay... nothing special at all. Let's start off with the cake. It was a bit dry for my taste and just fell apart when I tried to eat it with a fork. What a mess! In addition, it wasn't that rich in vanilla flavor, so I doubt high quality ingredients were used. On to the frosting, it tasted like it was store bought. Didn't taste gourmet at all. No bueno. Lastly, the cupcakes lacked in appearance. From the moment I walked into Cupcake Cove and saw the cupcakes that were on display, I was thinking how amateur they looked. They didn't look anything like a gourmet cupcake. The appearance of the cupcakes definitely played a part in my overall experience with Cupcake Cove. I would be lying if I said the way I perceived the cupcake didn't affect the taste of the cupcake.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I had passed by this place a few times before, where the sign was up, but the business had not been opened yet. It finally did, and I was more than happy to try it out.

The place is really small, almost like a indoor stand. There's only enough room for you to take a step in and look at the cupcakes and pricing.

There wasn't much of a variety (not that I was used to, anyway), but they were running a buy 3 get 1 free promotion. I got two red velvet, one mint, and one coffee.

$3 for a cupcake seems a bit steep, especially for the size (slightly smaller than Sprinkles). But considering the location (SF, Financial District), I guess it's understandable.

The coffee cupcake was pretty good, I tasted hints of toffee in it. The mint cupcake wasn't all that impressive. It was a chocolate cupcake with mint frosting, nothing special. I enjoyed the red velvet cupcakes (they were up to par, or better than the coffee cupcake).

The cupcakes were moist and held up for the next day, except my half-eaten mint cupcake; that was fine, since it was sort of free.

If I come back, it'll be for the coffee or the red velvet cupcakes.
author: Elaine N.

description: It's a cove all right, more like a den...wait a closet. Small and cute like a pick and go place which is perfect for the financial district (equal to Burrard business district in Vancouver). Typical flavors, nothing over imaginative. No gluten free so couldn't try anything sadly. Staff were friendly none the less.
author: Shila B.

description:
As good as the photos, only better. Glad to see this business is getting its due credit for what would be considered "classic" cupcakes.  If you had the time to make them.

Chocolate-Milk Chocolate: Marketing genius, good karma, serendipity.  I got handed a free cupcake on my way to the C.C.O.F. harvest festival in October, right before their Grand Opening.  I don't usually go for that flavor combination, which was a clear sign -- must go back and try more.

Other flavors: Red Velvet, Mint-Chocolate, Chocolate-Vanilla, Peanut Butter, Xmas and Lemon. 

The cake is moist, not crumbly, and they manage just a touch of crisp on the edges. The frosting is a rich butter cream with no funny aftertaste of shortening or too much butter (as if) but they also totally nail the flavors on different "toppings" such as the creamy peanut butter, lemon (like a meringue or tart filling, has egg), sugar sprinkled Xmas flavor and the unbeatable, uber cream cheese frosting.

Buy three, get one free.  Just like the sign says.
author: Anita B.

description:
My review is for a specific employee, Pete, who was extremely helpful with my transaction.

I no longer reside in San Francisco and cannot pick up the order I placed, as it is a surprise for a friend of mine. Regardless of my last-minute order, Pete kindly suggested flavor ideas (as this is my first experience with Cupcake Cove) and happily accepted my order for delivery.

I am very pleased with the customer service at this bakery and look forward to ordering from them in the near future.

Thank you again, Pete! :)
author: R S.

description:
I've never really understood the cupcake craze that swept the nation a few years ago.  And I still don't understand why it is still going on.  In any event, I decided to pick up a cute cupcake for my hon of hons birthday yesterday.  He realy iis not a sweet eater, but I wanted to get him something that I could put a candle in.

I ended up getting a mint chocolate cupcake, which was fabulous.  Very moist and deep chocolate taste.  The mint icing was a perfect foil to the deep chocolate taste.  The bonus was that the cupcake was packed into the cutest little box.  

Oh - and my HOHH loved the little treat!
author: .Hon H.

description:
Cupcake Cove or Smuggler's Cove?

The good:  200 Pine Street is a good location for FiDi orders, be they large or small.

The bad:  Over-priced and not customer friendly.  We ordered 6 dozen mini's and were given no discount off the price per dozen despite the size of  the order.  When we picked them up and asked why we got no discount, we were told that we would have gotten one if we'd asked when we ordered them.  Which was patently false, because WE HAD ASKED.  Worse yet,  they wouldn't even give us one or two extra cupcakes with our order when we asked for that instead of a discount.

The ugly:  To add insult to injury, Cupcake Cove charged us $0.25 for a bag to carry the 6 dozen cupcakes we'd bought.  Note that SF's city ordinance only requires charging $0.10.  Talk about nickel and diming -- literally and figuratively!

Bottom line:  We won't be back.  There are lots of cupcakes to be had in downtown San Francisco.  For example, Miette (Ferry Building) offers better quality cupcakes -- not to mention a more elegant presentation -- at lower cost, giving discounts and/or extras on the house.
author: D. V.

description:
PB&CC.

You won't miss the J. PB on a chocolate cupcake works quite well.

Small shop. Large selection. Massive peanut butter frosting flavor.

Enjoy the CC.
author: Jason B.

description: This place is only okay.  At $3/cupcake, I expected something much better.  What I got was something only marginally better than what I can get at a grocery store bakery like Safeway for a fraction of the price.   The flavors were not super interesting. The texture of the cupcake itself was above-par, but the icing was only average.  I would not go back at the $3 price.
author: John H.

description:
I had to yelp about this...I'm a big coconut fan. Usually a coconut cupcake consists of white cake with white frosting that has some coconut sprinkled on top. 

I was SO PLEASED to find out..that this coconut cupcake had a ton of coconut in it! in the middle of the cake as well as the frosting! 

happy customer :)
author: Dayna E.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.3 stars.

The cupcakes are quite pretty looking but a bit too sweet for my taste. If you buy singles they put it in an individual plastic container. It's cute but not sure if its not totally environmentally friendly.

If you love very sugary taste this will be for you.
author: T L.

description:
There are so many cupcakes all over the city and other places are definitely WAY better.

One reason why I feel that there is nothing special with their cupcakes is that the flavor of the cupcake is all in the frosting! Aside from the red velvet, their cake is either chocolate or vanilla. So you are really judging their cupcakes based off on how good their frosting is! First off, their cake batter is dry and not moist. Maybe I got a bad batch, but I just did not like the texture of their cake. I got six cupcakes, here is what i thought about each one:

Mint Chocolate: No mint taste at all, just tasted like I sugar.

Red velvet: This one was actually not that bad, but I have had way better. It had a slight red velvet taste, but definitely lacking the moistness I look for.

Peanut Butter: I love me anything peanut butter, but there was nothing peanuty about this cupcake at all. I thought this was the driest out of all the cupcakes and their frosting was bland too.

Passion Fruit: This is the only one I really enjoyed. The frosting had the right hint of passion fruit and it complimented the vanilla cake well. I liked the fruity smell and how the frosting was not too sweet.

Vanilla: Just a plain ol' vanilla cupcake, nothing too special.

Coconut Vanilla: I wish there was coconut in the cake batter. The frosting was bland.

If you have the scoutmob deal, go ahead and check it out since it is 50% off! But other than that, I would not pay for these cupcakes full price. Maybe their cookies are better?
author: Aiza B.

description: The name makes sense. This is a tiny store at a corner in SF. The girl who helped me guided me towards the red velvet cupcake and I have to say it is one of the best I have had.  They have oversized cookies as well which were tempting but I did not want a sugar crash later.
author: Sunil R.

description:
...Cupcake Cove
is small, tiny and situated in a corner spot

...I requested
one box of six-assorted cupcakes

...The best ones were
the Coconut and the Red Velvet

The cupcakes were tasty.
The selection, however, is limited.
The workers were friendly.
The transaction was flawless.
I would buy from here again.
author: Derek N.

description:
Moist, gourmet and DELICIOUS!  I love that there's a variety of flavors that are more unique than your average vanilla or chocolate frosting.  I am not a frosting girl but you will be delighted with the Coconut, Guava/Passion fruit, Salted Caramel and Pineapple ones.  It's not too sweet and it's a perfect combination with the vanilla cupcake.  I liked the Black Bottom cupcake, oozing of gooey cream cheese and chocolate chips.

There is usually a daily deal like buy 5 get 1 free. Or if you have the Scout Mob or Living Social app, there are good discounts.  This is a plus since a lot of bakeshops don't usually have any specials.  Without any deal, $3 for a cupcake can seem like a splurge but still worth every bite for me.  If I am gonna' splurge on calories, it better be damn' good!
author: Danielle P.

description:
I swear, I swear, if someone here knows how this cupcake trend/boom got started please let me know!
