All of a sudden these tiny one inch cupcakes started popping up at every event I went to. Cupcake stores started opening near my house. Cupcake bike deliveries. Cupcake hole-in-the-wall places. Yet, I don't know a single person who even likes cupcakes. They seem to be something more like, a nice iconic figure you can buy and eat.

Anyway, I bought about two bags of cupcakes from this location for a company party. I was told to get the "Red Velvet," apparently it's their most popular one. I'm not up to par with what the cupcake culture thinks the best flavors are BUT never in the world did I think I would find guava-flavored cupcakes. Are you kidding me? I barely find guava-flavored anything outside of Mexico and guavas are my personal favorite fruits!

Oh, and when it was time for that party...you know which cupcake I had? GUAVA! And after that, red velvet, and after that? Who knows! I tried mostly all and the presentation, moisture and sprinkles were just perfect. Maybe a bit too much frosting.

If you get two dozens, they give you extras. Shhhh.
author: Alexia R.

description: This place has seriously amazing cupcakes.  Dropped by with two coworkers to pick up 2 dozen for a coworker's birthday during lunchtime.  They had a ton of unique flavors to choose from.  Personally tried the strawberry and mango cupcakes and they were delicious!  Highly recommend!
author: Karen T.

description:
By looking at the star ratings on Yelp, I knew I wasn't expecting anything fabulous.  Got the red velvet, carrot (which were the only two that looked worth trying), coffee and strawberry.  The girl was really nice and offered to give me the last one for free...score!

I used my ScoutMob 50% off deal and my new Level Up app ($2 credit), which only totaled out to be $2.50 for all 4 of these cupcakes!  

Of course I tried the red velvet first - moist and better than expected, but not the greatest.  Carrot was reallllly moist and I almost wanted to eat the whole thing!  Coffee was eh, the only part that had caffeine flavor was only the frosting, which tasted a bit buttery and oily.  Strawberry was my least favorite, especially since it was pink frosting on top of a chocolate cupcake.  (Chocolate's not my thing.)  The chocolate was stiff and pretty bad.  No strawberry flavor whatsoever, and frosting wasn't the best either.  Maybe there was a reason why there was so much of this left.  I should've just gotten a free red velvet instead. 

I'd come back for either the red velvet or carrot again, espeically since this is the only cupcake shop around the FiDi.  For $2.50, I can't really complain much.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Playing tour guide for my buddy visiting town, really it's like the blind leading the blind.  I didn't know where to take him so we did the Ferry Bldg.  Then I figured we'd wander aimlessly downtown until we were tired, bored, or hit a BART station.

I asked the nice cupcake gal what was her fav flavor, she mentioned the strawberry chocolate.  I went with it.  The frosting was only mildly sweet, which I like, and a pleasant strawberry taste.  The cake itself was okay, but go for the frosting... that's clearly the star.  Nice gal, I always like friendly, cheerful and helpful service.
author: Bryan K.

description: Pretty good cupcakes at pretty good prices.  And its right smack in the middle of Downtown.  Get a dozen for your office.  That really is all you need to know.
author: Mark M.

description:
To the owners.....
i dont care how good these are, $3 for 2 bites is lot. Even if it were a Sprinkles. Remember the recession is still here. 
 
These are pretty small cupcakes. you almost always have to buy 6 for $15.  Even then its like over $2 a bite. 

For maybe .15 cents more batter, make a 30% larger cake. If you cant do that because of the current invested mold/cup sizes, then price them at $2.50, 4 for $8, and 11 for $20.  then do a  couple LivingSocial deals to bring people in to show the revised pricing.

Your sales volume will double and more than make up for the revised pricing. As it is, its pretty sparse every time i walk by.  Rent there aint cheap.
author: H D.

description:
Okay, not so bad...Cupkates truck wasn't out so we decided to try this place since it has a residence in the financial district.

I got the buy 5, get 1 free deal. I shared a few with my crew at work so I only tried a few bites. 

The ones I tried were mocha, red velvet, and the black bottom. The mocha flavor was a'ight. I wasn't really feeling the big chunky toppings. Flavor overall was good. The next one was the black bottom. That cupcake looked like a failure; it hardly looked like a cupcake. However, do not judge a book by it's cover, people! That was an amazing flavor/texture. It's a dark looking cupcake with cream cheese mixed in. It even sounds kinda gross now that I'm writing it out...trust me, this is worth trying! The red velvet was a miss, but to be fair, I'm not really a red velvet girl. The cake was slightly drier than expected and I didn't like the cream cheese frosting at all.
author: Chanelle N.

description: Guava Passion Fruit - Wow, what a great cupcake...the cake really did taste like guava and the passion fruit frosting was awesome.  This is a really unique tasting cake and coming from someone like me, who always has to have chocolate, I was very impressed.
author: Ken G.

description: Lemon, Chocolate, Carrot ohhh my! The filled one's are the bestttt@
author: Jessica M.

description:
Whenever it's someones birthday my momma comes here and buy a ton of cupcakes! I fell in love with everything I've tried! Red velvet, lemon, carrot, cookies and cream and so much more. 
I find myself excited for other family members'. birthday knowing there's gonna  a variety of cupcakes!
author: Jess G.

description:
I am a decent baker. Not excellent, but decent. So when I grab a gourmet cupcake, I expect it to have a little something extra in comparison to what I would be able to pull off alone in my kitchen, covered in flour. Cupcake Cove is at least more consistent than the products of my solo endeavors. But there's nothing particularly revolutionary about their taste, moistness, balance of flavors (there's no variety that's struck me as incredibly exotic or unique), or presentation. However, they are conveniently located and, to repeat, are at least consistent -- I've had many a tasty treat from here, and I've never had a bad one as of yet. 

I could see myself giving this place 4 stars based on my review so far; however, the customer service is where I knock off a star. I've had a few orders that have been a bit mussed by the Cove. Again, something I can understand, I'm sure they receive a lot of pick-up orders! But if the staff could have been a little more helpful, I'd have walked away happier. On one occasion, I waited for an extra 8 minutes (I timed it) while they tracked down a receipt to confirm that I was being given the correct order and whether I'd prepaid for it or not. The staff did not even apologize for the discrepancy or the resulting delay. I consider myself to be fairly patient, but I do appreciate when an establishment expresses concern for their patrons. And given that the Cove is really only set up for brief customer interactions (walk in, order cupcake, pay for cupcake, leave), every minute really counts. 

Overall, no reason to not place your office order for cupcakes here -- it's organized, comes in a nice box, and most times, there will be a fairly painless pick-up. But if you're seeking that something "extra" in your sugar rush, maybe check out some of the cafe patisseries in downtown.
author: Lexi H.

description: Red velvet was very moist and frosting was perfectly tart without being overly sweet. I like you a lot. You're delicious.
author: Beverly T.

description: Cupcake Cove is now my go to cupcake shop in San Francisco. John was so helpful and went out of his way to get my deliveries were made. I am looking forward to doing business with them again very soon.
author: Sharon R.

description: Disclaimer - the number of stars is due to their fantastic customer service.  I cheated on my favorite cupcake spot with Cupcake Cove because I had a mean craving and they were just a couple of blocks away from the job. I tried a few different flavours and shared the rest with my co-workers. If you buy 5, you get the 6th one free. I posted the variety in a photo.  The cupcake itself was a bit dense and didn't offer much of the flavor.  It was definitely all in the frosting.  Not to say it was a bad cupcake, it's definitely a decent cupcake, just not as fluffy and moist as I like them. I thought the frosting was a wee bit too sweet.  I was bummed they no longer offer the famous black bottom and it's the first thing I asked for when I got there. I went again today and tried the lemon. All of the flavor was in the frosting once again but hey, I ate them and my sweet tooth was satisfied. I probably won't go often since they were $3 per cupcake. Maybe as a treat for my co-workers. I did really enjoy the salted caramel and asked for it today but they had a different menu going. The guy behind the counter was so nice, he said he had batter ready and could bake one just for me. I thought this was a great gesture and that's what will keep me coming back.  The folks running this cute little shop are so kind and friendly, a welcome change from the usual FiDi rush and go service.  Kudos!
author: Ginger C.

description:
Came by a few days ago to grab some cupcakes for a special occasion

They have really nice store front, a bit small though but just enough for a few people to go ahead and step inside. 

I happened to come by on a "special" for buy 5 get 1 free, so I ended up getting a half dozen. 

I DIDNT get a chance to get the black bottom, but i wish i did. 
2 red velvet
2 coffee
2 vanilla

Overall? Pretty good. I've had some that were more moist, but that could also be my fault for leaving them in the fridge over the weekend before I tried one. 

Server: couple of girls working at the counter, having their usual chatter on a friday afternoon. They were quick with my order though and kept it professional

I'd be back! especially because it's so close to work
author: Kenny L.

description:
Pretty good place. It's the closest place to get cupcakes for my office so it's our go to spot for birthday treats. The cupcakes are always nice and moist. There are a few fruity flavors that are way too sweet and just not tasty. I recommend sticking to the more familiar flavors. Red velvet and salted carmel are my favorites.

Prices are cheap! They have a storefront where you can mix and match and buy individual cupcakes. Delivery to us is only $15.
author: Brittany P.

description:
I've been here thrice and I've devoured the red velvet twice. I would also highly recommend the guava. It's delicious. I brought  to my friend's party and it was a big hit! 

The Good Stuff:
-Red velvet
-Black bottom
-Guava
-Coconut

All had good moisture and perfect amount of sweetness in the cream. I wasn't choking on sugar when I ate them in one bite. :X

I haven't tried all of them yet, but these were ones that really stood out to me. The staff is incredible, and the baker is magnificent. I hope no more people go there to take all my flavors.
author: Ellenor L.

description:
I absolutely love cupcakes and have made it a mission of mine to taste every red velvet cupcake in the city. 

Cupcake cove has these beautiful cupcakes that look & taste amazing. The cake portion is super moist and delicious. The frosting is a bit of a sugar bomb (I could go for 1/4th the frosting & still be happy). Price is typical ($3.00 a pop) but they have this great, buy 5 get the 6th free dealio)

Will return - I recommend the white bottom (even though those are the only cupcakes that look like something went wrong,t hey are TRULY delicious)
author: linda t.

description:
I haven't visited this place but my mom has bought me some cupcakes here, she knows I love cupcakes, and damn near half of my reviews are on cupcake places.

It's standard that a cupcake is at least $3, there's no arguing that. But with the amount of different cupcake stores around, it's getting competitive and if I'm going to spend that much on a cupcake, it better be worth it.

My mom got me a mango and coffee cupcake. As I was telling her which one I want, I realized 90% of all the cupcakes they offer are either VANILLA or CHOCOLATE cakes with different frostings. The cupcakes I got were vanilla based and the vanilla cake was good, the frostings were okay. The mango frosting was okay and the coffee was okay as well. The cupcakes themselves weren't dry and were a really good texture.

But it's my pet peeve when cupcake places only offer vanilla or chocolate cupcakes as their base and use different frostings. It's LAZY, and I generally like the cake more than the frosting itself. 

So would I rather go to a cupcake place like Sprinkles and pay 50 cents more for a cupcake that have unique batters for each cupcake?
And would I rather just go to a small business owned cupcake restaurant that has more to offer?

Yep!!
author: Kathleen H.

description:
YUM-E

i just had a really good vanilla cupcake here.  i'm at work right now so i can't go into glorious, excruciating detail about my sublime experience.  but i can tell you i find this a superior cupcake establishment because the majority of their cupcakes have butter cream frosting and that's my favorite.  and they had a nice selection too.  and my cupcake had that home made cake taste.

the only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because my cupcake stuck to the paper and got all crumbly after i licked the frosting off.  it's really not the biggest deal in the world.

cup cake cove has great cup cakes.  they're frosting is good too.  cup cakes are $3.  it's a little pricey but whatever.  you should go there.
author: lori s.

description:
I placed an order for 30 cupcakes, to be delivered at 1pm.  They showed at 1.15pm.  Now, that isn't terribly late, but I had ordered them for 1pm and paid for it, so showing up on time should be a normal part of customer service. 

Then to top it off, I had ordered 10 vanilla cupcakes with chocolate frosting and they brought chocolate cupcakes with vanilla frosting.

However, the cupcakes themselves were very good!
author: Nicole H.

description: It's a pretty tiny but cute cup cake shop! Absolutely love the red velvet here! It's moist and not too dense! The cream cheese frosting is delicious, it's not too sweet it's just right!  Coming back here for my red velvet cravings!
author: Stella J.

description:
I've been here twice and I thought they were pretty good. They were not the best that I've ever had, but they are solid.

I like them enough to order 2 dozen mini ones for a small gathering at my company.  It was only $30.  To pay something like that in the Financial District is rare.  

I ordered online. Someone called to confirm they received my order and I didn't even have to pay in advance.  They said just pay when you pick-up. That level of trust in customers is quite unheard of, especially a bakery.  

Anyway, I ordered and on the date and time that I selected, I went to pick it up.  Everything was in a neat tiny placeholder inside the box so it wouldn't move around.  I also asked for 2 tiny boxes so that if there were leftovers, I could bring it home or give it to someone and they were more than happy to give them to me and did not charge me extra.  

The strawberry chocolate is divine! I love it. The flavors are just right.  The guava passion is just ok.  Mint Chocolate was also very good.  Maybe I had the mini's so the cupcake was not dry. The amount of cream/frosting to cake ratio was just right.

I will be back for more when the sweet tooth calls!
author: AhLin C.

description:
The staff is super friendly.  The location is incredibly small but so close to my work.  There should be a sign on the door that says "Maximum Capacity: 4."  That's the two workers plus two customers.  The cupcakes?  Well I would have to say they were not that memorable.  They weren't terrible but probably a 3.5 star.  I've only been in there once and walked by just a few other times. They only have limited flavors.  Seems like every time I pass by late in the afternoon, they don't have much out, so maybe if you go early it would be better.  I tried the mint chocolate and it tasted fine, but again, not the best mint chocolate cupcake I've ever had.
They do have the "deal" of buy 5 get the 6th free if that helps.  I wouldn't rule them out though and I'd probably try to give them another shot.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Just had a black bottom and red velvet right after my interview. I'm a fatty. What can I say?

The cupcakes didn't taste fattening and it was delicious. It made my taste buds happy! Definitely nice having this place near where I currently work. Although the cupcakes aren't big like Sprinkles, it was just what I needed to fill my stomach.  The price is expected.. esp since the shop is located in the financial district.
author: Jas H.

description:
Cupcake  Cove is across the street from my workplace, and if they were either good or cheap, I'd be there all the time.

Because of that, I am thankful that Cupcake Cove only makes mediocre cupcakes.  I found the cupcakes to be somewhat dry and the icing is just a sugarbomb.

Not nearly on par with Noe Valley Bakery and nowhere close to Baked on Potrero Hill.   Both also charge around $3.
author: Drew D.

description: Bad customer service. Do not have full disclosure of ordering policy on website but then adhere those "policies".
author: Perle D.

description:
I love cupcakes and will try cupcakes anywhere. I work near Cupcake Cove and have had the guava & passion fruit/vanilla and the vanilla/vanilla.

Their cupcakes are smaller than the cupcakes at Sprinkles and have less frosting too. Both cupcakes were just okay tasting.

Overall grade: C+
author: Shannon L.

description:
no parking unless you are allowed to park in the loading zone.

They have ONE REALLY GOOD cupcake...the Black Bottom!

The others are generic to me.  They are moist, but the frosting is a cream cheese type that EVERYONE uses for Red Velvet but its on all of the cupcakes except for the Black Bottom.

Its also 3 Dollars per cupcake!  3 DOLLARS!?!?!?!  its almost half the size of NORMAL cupcakes...i guess the economy is fine if you can afford 3 dollar cupcakes!

OR you're able to WRITE THEM OFF!
author: Bing D.

description: Yay!  A local cupcake joint to add to my list.  My former go-to was Kara's Cupcakes (yum) in the Wharf/Marina, which can sometimes be a bit of a trek to get to (but totally worth).  Cupcake Cove is conveniently located in FiDi, a great place for a snack in the middle of your work day.  I ordered the vanilla chocolate and red velvet, and they are delicious.  Looking forward to coming back!
author: Mel G.

description: My job usually orders from here. The cupcakes are pretty good. although, i am not too crazy over them.
author: Isa W.

description:
Red Velvet & Coffee/Chocolate - used the ScoutMob deal for 50% off so basically buy 1, get 1.

Red Velvet was fantastic - moist red cake with creamy cream cheese frosting. It tasted fresh too, like it hadn't been sitting out all day. Velvety like butta....

Coffee/Chocolate was good but there were crunchy bits of toffee (I think) on top of the icing which threw me off. I didn't like the flavor combo. The chocolate cake was moist but the icing seemed a bit hard, not sure if that's due to the crunchy bits on top or not....

Friendly service, tiny shop. They sell out of a lot of their flavors quickly too - I've stopped in a few times to check them out & they were basically empty! The to-go containers they put individual cupcakes in are super cute & don't squish the frosting which is essential - at $3 a cupcake you want them arriving looking perfect.
author: Marissa H.

description:
i didnt actually get to partake in eating a cupcake but i can say that their attention detail and the way they deal with customers is enough to make me want to come back and thats without the pleasure of a cupcake 

great customer service experience, highly recommend especially for bulk orders
author: Kat N.

description: My friend and I had lunch at Cafe Med across the street from Cupcake Cove yesterday.  I justified a cupcake splurge because I had a killer weekend workout and had stuck to the salad bar only.  Soooo, we proceeded to cram ourselves into the tiny closet-like space. The service was good but the ambiance and selection of cupcakes were lacking. I decided to go with the mint chocolate chip cupcake, which looked really good.  Looks are deceiving and I was disappointed.  The chocolate cake was dry and boring.  The icing was also on the dry side and the mint flavor tasted artificial. One bite into it and I had to toss it.  Waste of $3.00 and calories!
author: Ronita J.

description:
You can't go wrong with cupcakes. Really, you can't.

My only complaint was the day I came in, saw the salted caramel, decided I better not ruin my diet, came back (being the food lover I am) and it was sold out! wahh. LOL but if that's my only complaint you better believe its a good spot! I like the individual packaging you can carry your one cupcake back in back to the office with. ;)
author: Diana R.

description:
OVERALL:  Satisfactory if you NEED a cupcake and can't trek a few blocks to Batter Bakery kiosk.  This tiny store is soo close to my office, but sadly, proximity does not make up for taste.  Let's put it this way--my fave thing is the individual plastic containers they put each cupcake in.  Ok, their cupcakes are standard size, $3/ea with specials every now and then (e.g.: buy 5, get 1). Generally, pretty to look at, moist cakes but lacking in flavor.  Also, sprinkles/sanded sugar on the frosting detracted, not added, to cupcake experience.  They had about 5-6 flavors, all fairly standard.  They also had a few snickerdoodles (they rotate cookie flavors). 

CUPCAKES I TRIED:
-Vanilla Vanilla.
Cake: moist, but not very vanilla flavored.  Rather bland.  The more I ate the cake, the more it tasted like playdough.  Frosting: thick, but again, rather bland, lacked vanilla oomph, had a hint of brown sugar.  Was sprinkled with clear sanding sugar, which looked sparkly and bedazzled, but had the crunch of gritty sand.

-Red Velvet w/Cream Cheese frosting.
Cake: moist and crazy bright red (food dye overkill).  Could not detect a hint of cocoa in flavor. The texture of this cake closely resembles Paula Dean's from Foodnetwork. Frosting was tasty, but in my opinion was ruined by red sprinkles that were soft, mushy and flavorless. 

-Lemon Cupcake
Basically, vanilla cupcake w/lemon frosting. Frosting is OK, would have preferred more tartness.

RETURN VISIT?....UNLIKELY
I'm kinda curious to try the lemon cupcake, but I was told it is a vanilla cake w/lemon frosting. And since I determined that vanilla cake is like playdough,  playdough + lemon frosting (no matter how good) = no thanks.
author: Caroline I.

description:
I have just discovered this gem after they've been around for over a year!!

I will never have to bring donuts or cookies from Specialty's for office gatherings. They have about 8 choices per day and the peanut butter chocolate and salted caramel is devine. 

Mini cupcakes are pre-order only. $1.50 each or $15/dozen. They are just a bit bigger than a bite size. This is extremely convenient as they only need 1 day in advance for a pre-order.
author: Maggie C.

description: My coworkers bought me cupcakes for my birthday and so we had a nice assortment to sample. After cutting the cupcakes in fourths and tasting various flavors, I have to say they are consistently moist and delightful treats. The red velvet was a hit.  The only and very minor complaint is that the frosting was layered on thick; but it was easy to scrape off ( and we all did). Would recommend for your next office get together.
author: Lisse Q.

description:
After my interview I was walking towards Cupcake Grove because I passed by it when I was looking for parking. I knew that this would kill my diet instantly but in a way- I did not care! 

This place is small, very cute.. I saw a lineup of cupcakes and asked about the 2 kinds I was digging w/ my eyes.. he said, "Go w/ the black bottom" so that was what I got. I paid $3 for it, he put it in a clear cupcake holder thingy (very cute) and sturdy, and I left. 

I did not even wait to get to my car. I opened that sucker up and devoured it while I was walking.. in business attire, in heels, w/ my iPhone clutched in one hand and the cupcake clutched w/ my other hand.. it was purely moist, I must say! I enjoyed it but nothing I would go the extra mile to get but I was pleased that I tried and thumbs-up for the staff's service!
author: Tram N.

description: Delicious moist yumminess. My coworkers bought me these cupcakes for my bday today and I loved em. All. Almost -1 for being too good.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Mmmmmm. I just finished my first cupcake from Cupcake Cove. It was the coffee/chocolate one and it was AMAZING. I personally feel like $3 a cupcake isn't awful, Love At First Bite in Berkeley is beyond amazing as well and they charge at least $3 for their simplest cupcake flavors. Also, there is a Scoutmob deal for 50% off which I used, awesome deal.

The cupcake was really sweet, but not too sweet. Super moist as well, which was delicious. I also picked up a red velvet one, but waiting until much later to try that bad boy, very excited!!!! I've wondered about this place since I started working in the FiDi in July, and while I'm very glad I held out this long to finally go in and try their cupcakes, I'm afraid of how much I'll be going back, they are a block away from my office!!!
author: Dawn O.

description: I only eat Red Velvet cupcakes and Cupcake Cove is BETTER than Kara's and Suzies. The only other brand that will give them a run for their money is CupKate's. People here are crazy! I know a good Red Velvet and this is it. The Black Bottom is also really really amazing. It's $3....get over it!
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Cupcake Cove is my go-to place for special events at work. For every co-worker's birthday, Cupcake Cove is the place to pick up a cupcake or two. For holiday parties, Cupcake Cove is the place to go. It's nice that they are conveniently located in the Downtown hub areas - both in San Francisco and Oakland. For me, it's just about a half block away in the FiDi of San Francisco! However, what I wanted to write about was their excellent service on a particular day I was not in the office. I wanted to send a "thank you" to a team I work with. I was thinking about flowers, but I didn't think the gentlemen on the team would appreciate flowers much! Then, I thought about cupcakes! Who could turn down a sweet treat like that?! I called Cupcake Cove from home. I wish I could remember the gentleman's name that took my order. I believe he was the owner, but I'm not sure. It was such a last minute decision because I wanted it delivered within the hour of me calling. I ordered a dozen assorted cupcakes. He said, "no problem." I said I wasn't at work. He said, "no problem, we can deliver." I said it would be going to an office a couple blocks away on Montgomery Street. He said, "no problem." I said I wanted it delivered within the hour if possible. He said, "no problem." He didn't actually say "no problem" each time but I'm sure you get the idea. He was Very accommodating. Once my order was complete, he gave me my total and that was that. Then, I got a phone call about a minute later from the same man. He said, "I realized this was a gift, so I don't want to give them the receipt. Can I send you an e-receipt?" I said Wow, thank you so much for thinking about that before I did! So he processed my payment and sent me a receipt via Square. I thanked him Again before getting off the phone for the second time. I got confirmation from the team about 30 minutes later, and they were definitely surprised! I owe that to Cupcake Cove! Not only do I love their cupcakes (yes, I've had them on multiple occasions!), but I love their service as well! Thank you Cupcake Cove for providing the service that you do!
author: Marie T.

description:
Okay.. I just tried your place again because my kind co-worker bought 4 cupcakes.

Why does the coffee and lemon ones taste exactly the same - like corn muffins?? Does the flavor only applies to frosting? Yet there's barely any coffee or lemon flavor in the frosting.. all I taste is fat vanilla-ey buttercream frosting with a few lemon sprinkle on top to differenciate the two cakes.. You need to work on perfecting your flavors!

We had to throw them away.. I think I'm officially done with this place.
author: Catalina C.

description:
I really like the individual holder. But what I didn't like, and thus the low rating, is that they sprinkle SUGAR on top of the frosting making it sickingly sweet and unplatable. 

I did buy it at the end of my work day, and the cupcake tasted like it had been out for a while.

The mini cupcakes at starbucks are much better.
author: A K.

description:
Super cute little cupcake shop!  I got a lemon cupcake, with pretty yellow sprinkles.  :)  The cupcake itself was deliciously moist and the frosting was sweet, but not diabetes-inducingly so.  

On top of that, if you get your cupcake to go, they have mini clear cupcake holders so your cupcake won't get squished!  

I wish I still worked in the FiDi so I could get my cupcake fix, but it's probably better for my blood sugar that I don't...
author: Joyce H.

description:
I go a mile out of my way once a week to pick up a red velvet cupcake.
they're so moist and just the right amount of frosting!

I wish they had more options though, I want to try something different!
author: Melyssa L.

description: If you are dying for a chocolate fix, they have a lovely chocolate cupcake. My only issue is that the flavor is not that spectacular. It kind of tastes like cupcake mix from the store. The icings are good though.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
Oh man! I came here again to satisfy another cupcake hankering. And this time I tried the black bottom cupcake and OH BOY was it delicious! It had the right balance of cream cheese filling surrounded by chocolate chip-embraced chocolate cake. 

-At first, i was a bit skeptical since it did not look as appetizing as the other cupcakes because it didn't come with frosting. But I decided to try it because my tubby girlfriend and I had their red velvet w/ cream cheese frosting, which was amazing. I had to try another one of their cream cheese indulge-ments. 

-There was a new girl behind the counter this time. If i recall correctly, her name was Ruby(?) I decided to have small talk with her as she packed up my cupcake to-go and although she doesn't bake the cupcakes herself, her boss does bake them fresh daily! WOW they must wake up super early to get them ready before opening. So no wonder they're so fresh and moist!

-I wonder what they do with the unsold cupcakes at the end of the day....I would gladly take them off their hands!
author: Aron L.

description:
I love small, cute, baked good shops that are simple and sweet and good at what they do! Cupcake Cove fits this description very well. While the one sales associate was helping another customer, the super nice owner saw me next in line and took my order. 

I got the guava passionfruit vanilla cupcake. I was a little worried that the fruit flavor would be overwhelmingly sweet, as lilikoi often is, but this was a really pleasant flavor. The nice tanginess mellowed out the sweet - and it was sweet, but certainly not outside the bounds of tastiness - and with excellent textures in the moist cake and just-thick-enough frosting, I was a happy camper on the way back to my temp job downtown. Made my day!
author: Carly G.

description:
I am not impressed with this cupcake shop. There's nothing special about these cupcakes at all.  Thanks scoutmob for this discount because it was not worth it for me to buy these cupcakes for $3 a piece.  I bought red velvet with cream cheese, coffee with chocolate cake, strawberry with chocolate cake, carrot with cream cheese and peanut butter with chocolate cake.  Their red velvet cupcakes are the most lightest red velvety I've ever seen (other places I've tried had a deep red color to it). The cake doesn't have much flavor but the cream cheese frosting is really good.  Coffee with chocolate cake we meh.  I like the coffee bits to give it that crunch but overall I was not amazed by both the frosting nor the chocolate cake. The strawberry with chocolate cake is less than mediocre. Strawberry frosting has a light strawberry taste but when you eat it with the chocolate cake, the strawberry flavor losses it's taste. My dad actually ate the the carrot cake with cream cheese frosting but he said it was way too sweet for him, which was strange because he loves sweets!! Last but not least, my sister had the peanut butter with chocolate cake and she said it was ok. Peanut butter frosting was good but the chocolate cake was just any other chocolate she's ever had.

Listen to me cupcake lovers! If you want high impact flavors with rich and yet moist cupcakes, please go to That Takes The Cake on union street because they have the best red velvet cupcake in the city! They have unique cupcake favors that would bring you back for more.
author: Irene L.

description:
I was so very disappointed with Cupcake Cove. I adore cupcakes and was thrilled when they opened. Unfortunately, the cupcakes themselves leave much to be desired. The frosting is American style buttercream, the kind made with powdered sugar and shortening. The cake itself was dry and lacking flavor. 

I think they could really turn it around if they used REAL buttercream, a moister cake, and fillings. Give me a tender cupcake filled with caramel and topped with silky buttercream and I will stop in twice a week.
author: Paige M.

description: I never knew this place existed. I always catch the bus that goes up this street. Ordered a red velvet because the bakery in the Ferry building does not carry this flavor. $3 for a cupcake. Thats about average. The cake was pretty moist and good. They had a bunch of flavors that i would want to try in the future like the salted caramel. Maybe next week. lol
author: Jeff C.

description:
This is absolutely one of the best cupcake places in the city.

The last time I was there, I picked up a red velvet cupcake with a cream-cheese frosting that had just the right amount of tang to it; enough tang to offset the sweet chocolaty symphony I felt in my mouth as I bit into it.

The cupcakes are packed into little plastic display packs, not opaque boxes, so they are an attractive package if you're bringing them to your boss or to a loved one.

The place is small and convenient, but they know their cupcakes!
author: Jonathan R.

description: Fresh and delicious. Coco cupcake is my favorite.
author: Alexa X.

description: Cupcakes are pretty good and they take last minute orders which is awesome for procrastinators like me :) .. if you want small ones though, you have to have a day before order!
author: Meg S.

description: We wanted to love this cove given its proximity to our office but the cupcakes disappoint. The cake is dry and their frostings are so sweet (stick in your throat sweet) that I only eat about half the frosting. We've tried several flavors but have not been impressed. Go elsewhere unless you want a sugar spike!
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
SUCH a cute little corner, which I happen to pass by on my way home from running errands. Even though I had about 7 lbs of grocery, I figured 2 more cupcakes wouldn't be much. I got the guava with passionfruit frosting and chocolate with coffee frosting. I like how they have awesome cake to frosting pairings.

They were delicious!! You can taste the tartness in the passionfruit and I love coffee. The only thing is the frosting is a bit too sweet for me.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
My godfather died and I inherited a million dollars.  OK, so it wasn't quite a million but like me, my godfather was BIG on pastries and he would definitely approve of Cupcake Cove.  My bff is a pastry chef so I am used to constant supplies of out of this world homemade pastries.  And let me tell you (as I have said in many of my reviews), I eat a lot of cake.  The only bad thing about cupcakes is just that -- they're cups of cake, not entire cakes in and of themselves.  

I've seen Cupcake Cove a zillion times since I work just a couple of blocks away and would think to myself "who on earth would go to a store that sells nothing but cupcakes???"  Well, I figured out why, because these cupcakes are THE BOMB.  Since today was my first visit, I tentatively just bought one vanilla and one red velvet.  They were both out of this world.  Soft, fresh, just the right texture, both were just perfect.  The red velvet was sublime in the way it gently caressed my palette.   I was expecting them to be uber-sweet but they are just right.

The pricing is about what you would expect for a place like this in the FiDi, so I'm a little surprised to see some reviewers complain about the price.  No, they are not cheap, but they are not overpriced either.  

But dammit, two of those cupcakes weren't enough and I was left wanting more and I couldn't sneak out of the office before they closed.  Guess I'll have to go back tomorrow and buy several -- two cupcakes does not a cake make!  And I'll eat them in my office with the lights off, the blinds drawn down and crawl under my desk so that I don't have to share -- 'cos I don't share things this good.   

Call me a pig.  I don't care!  :)
author: Paul N.

description:
MY NEW FAVORITE! LOVELOVELOVE IT!

I seriously don't even like cupcakes, but my boss needed to pick up some cupcakes for a gift and I wasn't going to buy any, but looking at how delicious they looked, I immediately bought two. 

These are seriously the BEST I've ever had. Seriously, a little gem in the fidi for something sweet that's also cheap. 

Red Velvet and Black Bottom ALL THE WAYYYY! wooo. 

happy eating!
author: Liberty C.

description:
You have the freshest ingredients in your cupcakes and always a hit! 

No wonder you guys always run out of the popular flavors, it is sooo goood!
author: Artimmis G.

description:
Moist. Fresh. And just down the street. A bit expensive for a cupcake, but I'm sure their rent is high too.

Right next to a Papyrus Card store, so if you need to say, Thank you... you're in the right spot.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Caveat:  I've only had the red velvet cupcake.

This is the perfect representation of red velvet cake.  I don't even like cupcakes--usually they're all dried out and topped with 2 inches of too-sweet frosting.  I haven't given up on myself enough to enjoy that.  But these are spectacular.
author: Ben P.

description:
It was birthday celebrations at the office and I ventured to this micro shop for some carb infested treats.

Plus:
* Red velvet... this really is a plus, but first off let me confess Sprinkles still has my heart with their red velvet, and this one momentarily took me back by its hue of not so naturale nuclear red... I KNOW I KNOW red v isn't natural with food coloring, but this one could glow in the dark. I got over it quick and sunk my choppers into my #2 fave red velvet. DAMN the Cove is rockin' some piss your pants delish red v. So many cupcakeries try to rock the red velvet and fail. The Cove is a win win win!!!

*Moist ass cake with no hint of dryness.... ahhhhhhhh angels singing. So fresh, so moist, so very very nice!! 

* FROSTING!! Hellooooo  delicious frosting... you are light and feathery... fluffy... and ohhhh so airy...DELISH!
Minus:
Why oh, why does the PB chocolate only have PB in the frosting?! Granted TIS yummy  frosting, but it would be so much more tasty with PB in the cake. I know there are worse problems in the world, but can't a girl have it all?!

The short and sweet of it is this is a GREAT place.
author: Manuela F.

description:
Once in a while, a craving hits that you just can't ignore. Today, all I could think about was having a red velvet cupcake. After trying to resist for 12 hours, I caved and made the journey to the Cupcake Cove, right before closing time.
Imagine my dissapointment, when the person in before me, bought the last r.v. So I bought a vanilla & chocolate instead. The lovely staff must have seen the sadness on my face, because she went to the back and somehow produced one last red velvet for free. They made my day!
I'm eating it right now, with a cold glass of milk and it's awesome. The frosting isn't too sweet or too cream cheesey. Its perfect, and the cake is moist and flavourful.
Needless to say, I'll be back.
author: Yasmin M.

description:
I love love LOVE cupcakes.  

I fell in love w/ red velvet cupcake after trying it @ Sprinkles in SoCal 3 years ago.  B/c of my love for red velvet cupcakes, it inspired me to bake my own. Since then if I see a cupcake, especially red velvet, I won't be able to stop myself from trying it.

Given the buy 3 get 1 free promotion, I bought 4 cupcakes:

Chocolate bottom (chocolate with cheese and chocolate chip filling)
Red velvet 
Coffee (vanilla cake with coffee frosting)
Mint chocolate (chocolate cake w/ mint green frosting)

I didn't try the mint chocolate as I'm not a minty kind of girl, my friend had it and she said it was good.  But to give you some perspective, my friend isn't into sweets or baked goods and she's polite. 

I tried the red velvet first.  While they supposedly baked the cupcakes on site, the cupcake I had is not fresh.  The edges of the cake were hard, although the frosting was soft enough yet still retain its shape.  The frosting had the right amount of sweetness to it while not being over powered by the cream cheese.  The cake itself also tasted good.  However, the texture would be even better if it didn't sit on the shelf, exposed to open air for the past 3 days, which is what I suspected. 

Then I tried the Coffee cupcake.  The cake is a vanilla cake, they basically had only chocolate or vanilla cakes, the varieties are in the frosting.  The coffee frosting was good with the crunchiness of the toffee, but the cake itself was just meh...   i was wondering if its from a cake mix to be frank. 

Lastly, I tried the chocolate bottom cupcake.  It was pretty good, but again, the 3 day old texture was bothering me.  Instead of eating a soft fluffy cake, i was eating a chewy dense muffin. 

All in all, for the price of $3 per pop, I'd go back for the red velvet if i have the must-have-cupcake-craving.  


I would have rate it 2.5 stars if yelp allow half stars.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Damn you Cupcake Cove!  Why'd you have to open up so damn close to  my office???  Because of you it's not as easy to resist the sweet tooth!

My favorites are the black bottom and red velvet.  I'm usually not a fan of frosting, but the cream cheese frosting on the red velvet is damn good.  Not too sweet, and just the perfect amount of cream cheese flavor.  The cake is moist and yummy.  The black bottom reminds me of the chocolate cream cheese muffins they used to have at Starbucks, but WAY better.  

*sigh*.  If only you could eat unlimited amounts of cupcakes and not get fat.
author: Riza A.

description:
Nothing's better than going to work to find a tasty treat on my desk. Thanks to my kind and generous coworker, I've had the opportunity to devourer one too many cupcakes. Cupcakes were always moist and tasty. Some of the fruity flavored cupcakes were a bit too sweet to my liking. My top faves were the red velvet and chocolate peanut butter. 

Working with kind hearted people rocks!
author: hello k.

description:
Salted Caramel is the best.  These are worth the price. 

I like them as much as Kara's and Sift, which is a lot.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description: Cute teeny tiny place.  Very convenient for that mid day cupcake craving.  $3 is a little steep but what the heck.  Went for the buy 5 get 1 free special.  They still had a pretty good selection at 4pm.  Walked out with a variety of red velvet, black bottom & chocolate/chocolate.  The cakes were nice and moist and the frosting surprisingly wasn't as sweet as I expected.  On their site it listed the Guava/Passion Fruit was available that day but turned out when I got there they didn't have any that day at all.  Just the flavor I wanted to try too, Shucks!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Love their BLACK BOTTOM cupcakes!!! So moist, rich and chocolaty and just SO good. 

RED VELVET is Yummmy! 

CARROT CAKE cupcake is my next fave. The cream cheese frosting is not too sweet and is a perfect combination to the super moist cake. 

I also really like their PASSION-GUAVA, however, my cousin pointed out that most of the cakes is either white or yellow cake and only the frosting is flavored; Chocolate-Strawberry, Chocolate-Mint, Chocolate-Peanut Butter, Vanilla-Coffee. They pack on a lot of frosting so each bite is blended with the cake and your taste buds think the cake is a different flavor. REGARDLESS... most of the cupcakes and frostings are really good. It's kind of dangerous that they're located right across the street from my work!
author: Resa N.

description: I visited Cupcake Cove today and was greeted by a friendly staff.  I had the mint cupcake, and it was out of this world!  The cake was moist and light, but still retained its chocolate flavor against the minty frosting.  I normally scrape most of the frosting off my cupcakes but this frosting was perfect.  It was flavorful without being overpowering and it wasn't too sweet.  Perfection!
author: Alison H.

description: Just stopped in to Cupcake Cove on my lunch break. V and Rosalinda not only let me sample some of the "coffee candy" topping prior to purchasing a vanilla cupcake with coffee butter-cream, they even sent me out with a complimentary chocolate cupcake with strawberry butter-cream. Very good customer service and delicious cupcakes. I'll be back! Thanks!
author: Alicia E.

description:
MMMmmm cupcakes! This place it teeny tiny! I spotted it on a walk and my love of all things sugary sucked me right across the street and before I knew it I had a coffee cupcake in my hand ;) 

My feelings on it are so/so. I love the cupcake. The flavor is incredible! BUT... (maybe I got a bad one)-  its so crumbly it's litterally flaked 1/2 of itself down the front of me?

I'd be willing to try one again... but I'll make sure to be armed with a bib before eating!
author: maria K.

description:
I just finished my second cupcake from Cupcake Cove. I ate the first one yesterday, vanilla, and it was exquisite. Soft, moist cake, and a ridiculously high stack of butter cream icing on top with some sugar crystal sprinkles to make it crunch a bit. 

The second one was chocolate - I saved the best for last - and it was very good too. Unfortunately it was in the over sized box for 20 hours and got a bit stale. So I either eat them all the same day, or put them in a zip lock bag to keep them fresh. Win win.
author: Bailey J.

description:
Delicious cupcakes!!
I love Love LOVE that they can decorate your cupcakes for any occassion. Not many places do that!! They also have mini cupcakes, along with their original sizes.  :)
author: Lucia A.

description: These cupcakes are okay. Tried a lot of different favors. Nothing special.
author: Lovenicaa O.

description:
Mediocre -- a consolation prize if you're working in the FiDi and a cupcake craving strikes, but you don't feel like going to the Metreon for the far-superior Cako. I agree with previous observations reporting that the flavor is all concentrated in the frosting, and that the cake part itself is as plain as it can be. In fact, the cake was a little dry to me. I had the peanut butter cupcake and the pineapple cupcake. They each delivered as promised on their respective flavors -- until the frosting was all gone.

For 3 bucks a piece, I wanted a slightly more thrilling experience. All too often, a business is opened with the idea that a cutesy name and storefront will substitute for products of substance. It would be too generous to add an additional full star (for a total of three) for presentation, which I admit is pretty for the cupcakes here. Ultimately, the overall experience is a 2-starrer, and you're better off looking elsewhere for cupcakes if there's nothing else holding you back.
author: Joseph R.

description:
I was skeptical of this place based on the mixed reviews but decided to try a few different flavors before ordering it for an office b-day. It was DELICIOUS! The best cupcakes I've had in a long while. It's fresh, moist and not overly sweet. I can appreciate the crisp edges and tops of the non chocolate cupcakes. The ingredients are FRESH and QUALITY! I tried a bite of each of the following flavors and they are all worthy!  I hope they expand on the menu and add flavors such as Coconut, Carrot and Banana.

1. Red Velvet
2. Chocolate Peanut Butter
3. Chocolate w/ Chocolate Frosting
4. Lemon
5. Vanilla w/ Vanilla Frosting
author: Mai G.

description:
It's ok.  I was really looking forward to this place because of the generally positive reviews, and because it's close to my office.  I had tried going there last week around 2 PM but they had closed early because all their cupcakes were sold out.  Today, I was finally able to get my hands on a red velvet . . . it was good, but they had burnt part of the cupcake and covered it with frosting.  Not cool for a $3 cupcake.  Also, it left a weird taste in my mouth- possible because it was burnt.  

Overall it was just ok.  It's on the pricey side for a small/medium cupcake, but for a place that is able to close at 2 pm for being sold out, I expected much more.  Actually, I think the cupcakes inside the grocery market at Westfield taste better, and you get more for your money.
author: Dean L.

description:
You know, I'm a fan. I quite enjoy the red velvet ones.

I think if I can tear myself away from the red velvet then the next one I'll try will be the black bottom. Also good - the large cookie sandwich things. Fiance had one and he said it tasted like a huge nutter butter.

Additional goodness - the people who work there are always so nice and happy.
author: laura f.

description: Yum...Red Velvet, Mint Chip, Lemon Drop,Penut Butter...It helps when there is a buy five get one free deal to try all of the flavors. It worked out to about $2.50 a cake and the office enjoyed them within about 5 seconds...Its close to the FiDi.  This place is smaller then my closet, but they are turning out some good cakes.
author: Sarah M.

description: Cupcake Cove is my go-to when I want to surprise someone with a treat! From birthdays to bachelorette parties, these cupcakes are always a hit!  The flavors change from day to day with a few staples that are always available.  At $3 a cupcake, it can get pricey but literally every time I've been there the "special" is buy 5 get 1 free so it works out to $2.50.  The staff are always friendly and they accept phone app payments like Level Up.
author: Liz H.

description: I'm a fan of their guava passionfruit vanilla cupcake.  Their other flavors are ok.  It's a bit on the sweet side, but a great combo with the cake.   The cake itself was moist.  The size is just right and only $3/cupcake.  Beware, they can run out of flavors towards the end of the day, so may want to call before you head down there.  Check their website for their daily flavors if you're craving a particular one.
author: Julia C.

description: Very tasty vanilla/vanilla cupcake! It's very (hate this word, but...) moist throughout, with a little chewiness on the muffin-top part. Great treat for $3!
author: Jen D.

description:
Got a cupcake for Valentine's Day. Got the coffee creme on vanilla cupcake, and it was tasty (well according to my Valentine it was).

$3, a bit pricey, but that seems to be the going price for fancy cupcakes nowadays.
author: Eddy N.

description: The cupcakes here are average to above average, and provide a sweet afternoon sugar boost.  What puzzles me, however, is what appears to be the aroma of fried chicken or fried oil wafting from within this cupcake store.  Whether or not it actually originates from Cupcake Cove, the smell dampens my appetite for cupcakes.
author: Chris T.

description:
I've been here 4 times and it's not so much because they're to die for, but I'm the biggest cupcake fan and it's less than a block from my office. 

They have an assortment of flavors and my favorite is the Vanilla/Chocolate which is a vanilla cake w/chocolate frosting. I know it sounds ridiculously average but vanilla cake is my all time fave. 


The cakes are pretty moist and the frostings are a tad on the sweet side. For overall flavor and appearance I would give 4 stars, however for the size that they are it should really be $2 each instead of $3. If you buy 5 you get 1 free... I don't know if that helps any. I guess that's San Francisco pricing for ya.
author: Jessica W.

description:
This is a cute little (and I really mean little) shop in the FiDi. I picked up 6 cupcakes ($15) for my coworkers bday. While the cupcakes themselves looked super cute, they tasted just ok. I was really impressed with the frosting. I had the cream cheese frosting on the red velvet cupcake and it was light and not too sweet. Very yummy! The red velvet was ehhhh....I have definitely had better. Everyone agreed that the chocolate was the best cake and that cream cheese and peanut butter were the best frostings. I would come back for some lunch time dessert.   

Eat it. Like it. Repeat.
author: Jenna s.

description:
Uhhhh. My coworker made a phone order the day before Valentines for 30 red velvet cupcakes for pick up at 1:30PM, only to find out the next day at 1:30 that they had run out of cupcakes. While they did whip up another batch, we were still delayed from picking them up for another 45 minutes. I know that Valentine's Day is a huge seller, but I just don't understand what kind of store accepts a phone order and can't complete it by the time promised, because they had RUN OUT OF THEIR SUPPLIES. I would have assumed that they would have set aside 30 cupcakes to avoid this problem. Also, when we went, the two people working didn't even know what was going on. The first lady told us that they only made 24 red velvet cupcakes and we would have to have 6 of another flavor, before the second lady in the back told us all that all 30 red velvet cupcakes had been completed. It's a miniscule store, and I'd just like to think that the people sharing such a cramped space would communicate better.

In terms of the cupcake, the frosting was really delicious. The cupcake part was kind of oily and flavorless. Gross. When I was eating it, the oil that had soaked through the cupcake wrapper coated my fingers and was deeply unsettling.
author: Melody L.

description:
First of all, I really appreciate that the owner sent me a message apologizing about the first experience I had with them and I decided to give them another shot.

Cupcakes are really moist but frosting is a bit on a sweeter side. I may want to more and maybe I can update my review and finally give them higher number of stars.

It'll probably take time =)
author: Czarina Y.

description: Emergency coworker birthday party. We needed cake for 5 people! A whole cake would have been too much for us, and then I remembered Cupcake Cove was just around the corner. We got something vanilla, something chocolate, and red velvet. The cake was dry and the available flavors were boring and limited. Eating cake should be a treat and the extra calories need to count. The chocolate cake with vanilla frosting I had was disappointing.  I can see myself coming back for the urgent need for cupcakes or out of convenience, but the taste of the cake won't be the reason for my return.
author: Su K.

description:
Solid.  Cute sensical shop.  I say sensical because I feel like some cupcake places are gigantic when its like dude.  You're just selling cupcakes.  Maybe drinks.  Do you need a freaking lobby?  

Anyhoo, my one gripe with this place was that the cake was a bit on the dry side.  The only thing that saves them is that their vanilla frosting was FAB!!!  Chocolate frosting was okay...  

Not the best cupcake I've had, but def not the worst.  At least there's a cupcake place by my job now...?  YAY!  lol
author: Jammir G.

description: I'm a sucker for cupakes. This place has a mean coffee cupcake & the red velvet is also pretty good too. I also like how they come in individual cupcake packages (so cute)! When I went they had a buy 3 get 1 free deal, so I couldn't pass that up! =)
author: Krystel M.

description: Saw this place on the way to the subway and decided to try it out. I love a good cupcake and I'm always down to try one when I get the chance. The only problem is that I always compare the cupcake to Kara's Cupcakes. I tried the Carrot Cake and Coffee cupcakes. They were both "meh" as far as cupcakes go. Nothing too special and the flavor just wasn't there. The cupcakes also seemed a bit dry as well. Onto the next cupcake tasting adventure!
author: Thimetis M.

description: Nothing special. The cake isn't always moist, sometimes dry. Good variety of flavor options though. I come here occasionally for my cupcake fix after lunch and it kinda does the job. I'd much rather have a Sprinkles any day though.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Stopped at a RED light, looked to the RIGHT, spotted CUPCAKE COVE, pulled over at a YELLOW zone, ran over to ORDER, ran back to my CAR, ate my cupcake, drove off with a SMILE :)

The cupcakes are Moist, Fluffy, and Delicious! 
Peanut Butter Cupcake - my favorite!
Lemon Cupcake 
Vanilla Cupcake 
Red Velvet - second favorite!

The size is generous for $3 and each bite got me craving for more! My favorite is Peanut Butter Cupcake. The frosting is semi-sweet and flavorful. The cake is amazingly soft. 
I regret not ordering the Black Bottom and Mint Chocolate. until next time!

I will definitely keep this COVE in mind for holiday parties!
author: K L.

description:
BAD experience.  I special ordered cupcakes for a party tomorrow and when I went to pick them up they were closed!  Door locked.  A sign said:  SOLD OUT.  True, I was supposed to pick them up earlier but couldn't.  A voicemail was left on my phone and the person spoke so fast (and with a foreign accent), that I couldn't even understand her.

I'll get my cupcakes somewhere else.  Thanks for nothing, Cupcake Cove!
author: Marlene A.

description: Rating based only on this one cupcake. Had a mango chili pepper cupcake. Good mango flavor with some spiciness in the icing , and super moist cake part. Usually that is the forgettable part of a cupcake, but this was great. Want to try others now.
author: E. W.

description:
I had to order 120 cupcakes within 2 hours and they made it happen.  I also had to charge it on 2 separate cards, separate into 4 different boxes, and had to have it delivered 2 blocks away to different floors of my building.  

Thank you for putting up with me.  I'm really not high maintenance at all ... my boss made me do it because he's addicted to the cake!
author: Yun C.

description: I tried their mint chocolate cupcake and after two bites, I couldn't take another. The frosting was very dense and sweet and the cake was dry.
author: Julia S.

description:
Summary: Small cupcakes for $3. Good, but not differentiated and a bit overpriced.

Stopped by to try a cupcake. The bases were mostly either vanilla or chocolate, with various frostings. They also had a black-bottom cupcake and cookies.

I tried a black-bottom cupcake. Was good and moist, but small and fairly expensive for what it was.

It's close to my work, but am not sure if I'll be back. I'd rather get a pastry from a Specialty's nearby.
author: Gary Y.

description:
I thought these were really good. I just happened to walk by, and the office had been having a rough morning, so I bought six for my co-workers. The cake was moist and the frosting not too sweet. Everything tasted natural. They're very pretty, too, and the people were nice.

I like the chocolate mint one the best, but the vanilla with vanilla frosting is tasting good right now, too.

I'm glad someone is selling good cupcakes that isn't way the hell out in the Mission.
author: Karen H.

description: Excellen-tay... My coworker brought some in for us today, his last day here, tear...  I had a delicious vanilla cake/creamcheese frosting/toasted coconut one.  Yum Yum!
author: La C.

description: Sarah was dying for a cupcake after her steak sandwich....so we had to track this place down via IPHONE maps. I had the black bottom cupcake. it was great. Maybe not 3.00 great, but good enough. Sarah had the red velvet, which she used a fork to eat so she wouldn't miss a single crumb. Next time I'm overriding her and heading to specialities for a giant cookie..but my cupcake was decent the guy behind the counter gave Sarah some grief (in a friendly way), and she called me an OLD friend, so I was happy to see her taken down a notch.
author: John T.

description: I had never heard of or had cupcakes from cupcake cove, but someone in my office had some delivered...So I was curious and wanted to try. For my co-workers bday, I had someone pick up a few, there wasn't much left by time she got there, but what she got was awesome. I had the guava passion fruit, it was moist and delish. I love them the best over the other cupcake places I've tried like...kara's or cakos (although they are good) Cupcake cove is the best. My friend had the red velvet, and she said it was really good, and better than kara's.
author: Desiree S.

description: Have walked by this place many times but could never muster the courage to splurge $3 on a cupcake. Well, today I got a 50% off coupon and bought 7 cupcakes! After munching on three of them, I had to stop and write this raving review. Cake is moist and tender, full of flavor. The frosting is generous, not too sweet and a perfect complement to the cake. My favorites (so far) are black bottom, red velvet and salted caramel (all three that I've tried so far!). After tasting how great these are, I might just go and buy them regular price to treat myself every once in a while. Help out this cute little cupcake shop and give them a try! The staff are really friendly too!
author: George T.

description:
Good cupcakes -- what you'd expect from a cupcake specialty store.  Only enough room for two people to stand (one to order, one to wait), and no seating.  Was pleased to see they take credit cards, which is always a 50/50 proposition for small food sellers.

Wife had the black bottom, I had the peanut butter and chocolate, and both were tasty.  Neither were life-altering, but I'd definitely eat there again.
author: Adam T.

description: go try Kara's or cupKates from that truck that comes to SF financial district on weekdays... that's what a cupcake should be.
author: Margaret W.

description: This is torture for my body but it wont hurt if you try there cupcake once in awhile. I think having the price  for $3 is way too much for that size. But I wont complain  your cupcakes are delish!!! Try there red velvet...
author: Miss Monette R.

description:
I've heard about this place from a co-worker. This is not very close to my work so it was a stretch to try the place... 
I usually call before picking up cupcakes, since I order 25 of them. I came here three times to get cupcakes for birthday parties in my office. They have a good deal where you buy 5 and get 1 free. Originally, I thought this was a 'special' that we got for our company (silly me), but it is for everyone.
All the three times that I've been here, I ordered cupcakes in rather large quantities. The boxes that they give you are pretty big and its quite diffiucult to carry them several blocks back to the office. So I always ask for a bag. The first time I came here, they told me they do not have bags. The second time, however, they did and they put my two and a half boxes full of cupcakes into bags. At this point, it was customary, and since having a cupcake place in FiDi, you'd assume that many will need bags to carry cupcakes back to their offices... NOT! I came here the third time and asked for a bag (as I usually do) and the girl at the counter got very inconsiderate and rude. She told me that they simply don't have bags (in the worst tone ever) and acted like I demanded something stupefying!... So uncouth! 
When I called to have an order placed for the fourth time, the guy on the phone told me "that they don't have the buy 5 get 1 free" deal, because I was mean the last time... (because I requested a BAG?!?!?) Seriously?!... Granted, it was a good deal, but it's not worth it when dealing with bad customer service!

The summary:

1 star off-- No bags (to carry large boxes several blocks back to the office)
1 star off-- For being rude and for false accusations. 
1 star off-- For not accepting Amex... (its a hassle when you can't use your corporate card for office purchases) =]

The cupcakes: Their red velvet is pretty good. Everything else is dry and kinda average... not really worth $3 a pop.

Sorry for the rant guys, but I had to tell the community of my personal experience. =)
author: Yuliya K.

description:
meh...  

Riding the cupcake popularity wave with great presentation, decent service, and a so-so product.  I've had better baked goods from a Suzy Homemaker Easy-Bake Oven.  There are more fulfilling ways to ingest $3 of bad carbs.
author: Andrew S.

description: Had a few like the PB, red velvet, and a couple unmemorable ones. They're a little on the un-sweet side to me. Good location though. Only cupcake place around there.
author: Timothy L.

description: Delicious cupcakes and convenient FiDi location...the mini cupcakes were perfect for an office party! I tried the red velvet and chocolate with vanilla, both were very good and cutely decorated.
author: Gina C.

description: So I ordered a mint chocolate cupcake this time around and I had to lower my rating. The cake was too dry and not as minty as I would like it to be. The frosting tasted like vodka. That Takes the Cake is still my favorite place.
author: Linda L.

description: So I just tried to give this place one last shot!!! RUDE, RUDE, AND MORE RUDE. This is the second time I have tired to order from this company and have received poor service. The first time I was picking up an order and the now confirming one via phone.  I will never recommend cupcakes from this place. I called to confirm my order and the young lady who answered the phone was so rude, I cancelled my order. I will be going to Suzie's or Sprinkles.
author: Terri L.

description:
Since I'm the authority of sweets, I will say, I was pleasantly surprised.  I had the Red Velvet which was pretty tasty.  I concluded that the cake can stand alone without the frosting which is my true test for a decent cupcake.  I was able to try the mint which I found to be too sweet and not too minty and the coffee which tasted more like maple - both were decent.  The red velvet is my favorite thus far.  
On a side note, to all the cheapos that have complained about the $3 price (which is actually lower than any cupcakery in the city) need to stop complaining - if you want a cheaper cupcake, then go to Safeway or Epplers and have fun feeling like crap because you would have consumed twice as much sugar and whatever crappy ingredients they use.  I'm pumped there's a decent cupcakery in the Financial District where I'm sure rent is high and lunch spots are not cheap therefore, I think I'll take a miserable $3 cupcake anytime!
author: Danielle V.

description: YES! Cupcake Cove is so awesome. Their red velvet cupcake is superb. I have also had the lemon, and vanilla flavors. The cake is not too dry or too moist and the frosting doesn't overpower the cake. What I like most about Cupcake Cove is that they do not always have the same flavors. The people that work there are always very nice.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Stopped by during lunch time to check this place out. I've been having some cupcake cravings for the past few days so it seemed like a good idea.

The store lies at the corner of two fairly busy streets and the interior is quite small. Luckily when I went in there was no line, but as soon as I ordered wo/men in suits started piling up behind me. They currently have buy 5 get one free special and offer two sizes (regular and mini), but need to give them 24 hrs notice in advance to order the minis. The change their flavors everyday and I ended up ordering

red velvet, salted caramel/vanilla, black bottom, guava/vanilla, coffee/chocolate and PB/chocolate.

They have more flavors other days but I chose today because the ones that interested me the most were served today.

I usually don't like frostings on cakes/cupcakes because they are way too sweet. I noticed that cakes everywhere are just jacking up prices, jacking up powdered sugar in their cakes/frostings but decreasing the size. :(

I've gotten used to the size of the cupcakes getting smaller and smaller but I thought the regulars ($3/cupcake) here were the small size. I guess I just haven't been eating a lot of cupcakes lately (good for me~).

The GOOD for me is that the frosting wasn't as sweet as other cupcakes I tried. This is a big plus since now I will go back for seconds.... may be not today.

I had salad for lunch but ended up with a red velvet and a coffee for dessert. not good... I was going to bring the cupcakes back home but now I'm not sure if there will be any to bring back. Great for FiDi
author: Shikshin G.

description:
Really good vanilla cupcakes! The icing has bits of sugar sprinkled on top which you think would be sugar overload but it worked really well.

Also had a bite of the red velvet which wasn't bad either but I've had better. In any case, they are offering special deals - buy 2 get 1 free - right now but not sure how long it will last.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: Had my first red velvet cupcake and it was delicious. A great little whole in the wall on the corner of Pine Street. Definitely worth checking out. I went in with some co-workers and they were having a special...buy 5 get one free so we all got 2 each. It was a nice afternoon pick me up. Check it out if you get a chance.
author: Megan D.

description: Tasty cupcakes for a fast bite.  The container for single cupcake is brilliant reducing risk of frosting catastrophe
author: Chris H.

description: Hubby suggested I check this place out since there's a line out the door daily. Well, it only takes 3 customers to make the line go out the door. I tried the red velvet and the black bottom. Both were cool for a little something sweet in a pinch. I mean I wouldn't go all out of my way to get there, but if in the area, sure.  They're likely makin' a killing at that location.  Call me if u guys decide to hang up your baking mits. Would love to have that spot.
author: Renee M.

description: Preface: I have really high standards for cupcakes. REALLY high. So when I dish out $3 for a cupcake, it had better be awesome. Cupcake Cove is, for me, better than most other cupcake spots in the city (this town is, admittedly, full of abysmal cupcake options). The cake has a good, moist texture (which is shockingly rare). The flavors are nice if a bit bland. I firmly believe that sprinkles should counterbalance the other flavors/textures in a cupcake. The toppings they use are unnecessary and somewhat damaging, in that they add neither texture nor flavor yet make it overly-sweet. The red velvet sprinkles are mushy (no texture) and too sugary for the cupcake. The chocolate-chocolate cupcake uses chocolate chips, which is overkill.  Furthermore, the options are - shall we say - very traditional (read: boring). I'd ideally give it 3.5 stars, but just can't justify 4.
author: Anonymous F.

description: this place just opened around the corner from my office..I tried the peanut butter cupcake and it was delicious!  I'm going to have to start working out more :)
author: Erin D.

description: My only compliment is the single cupcake to go containers. Those are handy!  I sampled the Red Velvet, Chocolate, and Mint Chip. The cake portion was ok, nothing special.  The frosting made my tummy ache for an entire day. It tasted as of a 50/50 mix of Crisco and Sugar.  Dense and greasy.  My coworkers all agreed.  Too bad, it is a very convenient location....
author: Rachel D.

description: I sure miss this place! This is a great cupcake place if you are located in the financial district. I no longer work in the city so I won't be enjoying the fabulously delicious cupcakes anymore. All the cupcakes are really yummy, tasty and not too sweet. I also like their frosting which isn't hard and overly sweet. My faves are the vanilla/ vanilla and the guava passion fruit.
author: Julie L.

description:
I wanted to send cupcakes to a recruiter who had been working extra hard for me as a Thank You.  I live in LA so I scoured the web looking for a good place.  After countless crappy sites, mediocre menu options, and finding that most didn't even offer delivery service, I finally reached out to a friend in SF and asked for her recommendation.  She immediately wrote back saying to go to Cupcake Cove.  Their site was easy to navigate and didn't look like it was made at the dawn of the internet, their menu was divine, $15 delivery service (which is standard in LA) - done and done.   I even emailed them after I placed my order asking them if I could include a note and they responded back very quickly saying that that wouldn't be a problem and they would print one out for me and attach it to the box.  Delivery was at the time I had requested and I got a lovely Thank You note for my Thank You cupcakes, saying that I made her whole HR team happy.  Apparently, this is her favorite cupcake place, her favorite flavor being the Red Velvet.  I couldn't resist ordering some of the Guava & Passion Fruit with Vanilla because they sounded so intriguing which she said she had just tried the week before and loved as well.  

So granted while I never have tasted one of their cupcakes myself, I can vouch on their service and quality based on the feedback from the recipient.  I'm a very happy customer indeed.
author: Leslie H.

description: A cupcakery in FIDI.. what a great idea!  I know I'm always looking for a sweet snack in the afternoon and this is perfect.  I really liked their mocha cupcake.
author: Robyn B.

description: The chocolate chip cookies are good, although a bit too big. Try the salted caramel cupcake, which is killer!
author: David B.

description: The place is a small little cupcake shop with interesting flavors. They have a good deal if you buy 5 cupcakes because you get one free. The red velvet was BOMB! Super moist and very delicious. I was a bit disappointed with the salted caramel because it was just ok. They have a unique cupcake that I think is called a bake off, which is a combo of a brownie and cookie morphed into a cupcake.
author: Elliot T.

description: Got a box of cupcakes for my birthday, and was suprised. I'm not a fan of this designer cupcake trend that started the past few years, but there cupcakes were full of flavor and had great texture. Interesting flavors (mango I think?, Pomogranite) as long as traditional ones (red velvet, chocolate, etc.). Not sure if I'd go back, but if I had a friend that loved cupcakes I'd cop a box or two for their birthday.
author: Steven T.

description: This is a solid place. The store size is small but, they have lots of cupcakes. Yesterday we needed 70 cupcakes in 15 minutes and it was no problem.  Most importantly the cupcakes were good.
author: jack d.

description: We got buy 3 and get one free.  $3.00 mediocre cupcakes.   Red velvet looked bright red for what I'm use to seeing.  It was missing cream cheese flavor frosting and the cocoa taste for this red velvet cupcake. Coffee crunch's frosting a bit solid and very sweet and the cupcake was dry.  Black-bottom was bitter.  Mint chocolate did not have a compliment taste.
author: pengrin ..

description: The weekly special was buy 5 get one free so I did. My coworker ate a chocolate on vanilla. She said the frosting was too sweet & put her in a sugar coma. I was a good girl and waited until after dinner to try them. I originally heard about Cupcake Cove from Vicky L., my culinary soulmate. I totally forgot about it until I needed to pick up dessert & wanted to go somewhere close to my office since it was pouring. I tried almost every flavor they had but they have different flavors depending on the day. My favorites were black bottom (holy chocolate!!!!) and red velvet. The other flavors were good but like my coworker said, the frosting is a little too sweet. I never thought I'd say that.
author: Sara P.

description: love this place. always come here for office parties :)
author: Jackz C.

description: They're delish!  I don't know if they're spectacular yet, as you cannot judge a cupcake place by one cupcake alone.  They were all out of the red velvet, so I tried the PB Chocolate one.  Very yummy, moist and not too sweet. Just the right amount of chocolate and PB. Very bad knowing that there's a cupcake place that's close and good.
author: San D.

description: These are really great cupcakes. I've bought a mixed dozen twice now for office birthday celebrations, and these cupcakes are always a hit. My personal favorite is the Black Bottom, and my co-workers love the Red Velvet, too. I haven't found a flavor that I didn't like.
author: Anne M.

description: I tried three cupcakes here and I'm sad to say they were very underwhelming. I had the red velvet, salted caramel and mint chocolate.  It was hard to find the mint flavor in the mint chocolate - you could taste it somewhat in the icing and the chocolate cake tasted like a supermarket bakery cupcake. Not that I don't like those, but this is a specialty cupcake place - I had higher hopes.  The same for the salted caramel -  it just tasted like another vanilla cupcake. The red velvet was the best - it was very buttery and rich. I heard good things about the guava passionfruit cupcake so maybe next time I'll have to try that.
author: Amy N.

description: Some of *THE BEST* cupcakes I've ever had. BLEW Sprinkles, Kara's and others away. Moist, dense, elegantly designed, and the frosting was a pillow of fresh goodness, (REAL strawberry mixed in with the frosting). Finally a cupcake worth the price. These cupcakes (and "signature swirl" ) remind me of the cupcakes on that show DC Cupcakes.
author: Rebecca S.

description: We got an assortment from Cupcake Cove today to celebrate a co-worker's birthday. I had the carrot cake and it was delicious! My husband and I had carrot cake for our wedding cake, so I'm pretty picky about it. The frosting was awesome, too. I didn't try any of the others, but everyone seemed happy with theirs also (we also got red velvet, choc. mint, lemon, chocolate-peanut butter, etc.).
author: Jenny R.

description: Some coworkers brought these heavenly cupcakes to the office today and they were DELICIOUS. The first one I tried was a chocolate cake with peanut butter cream cheese icing and the cake was super moist and delicious.
