The second one I tried was a coffee flavored icing on white cake and it was even better! The flavors are great, but a tad bit too sweet. Overall they're great after-lunch desserts!
author: Rosa C.

description: I was lucky enough to get a dozen of these awesome cupcakes.  They were all yummy but of course I had to have a favorite!  Well, it was actually two favorites...RED VELVET and COFFEE!  They are must haves!
author: Stella C.

description: Cupcakes are ~$3. Got the buy 5 get 1 free deal. Pretty cupcakes. Black bottom was yummy & moise. Good service.
author: Joanne W.

description: Looking at other reviews maybe my cupcake palate is off, but this bakeshop is while I still have faith in cake in a cup. Pineapple pineapple is pretty sweet but the flavor is spot on and the cupcake is moist without falling apart. Guava passion fruit vanilla is a pink ray of sunshine  and the actual strawberry in the strawberry chocolate frosting just makes me smile. The standouts to me are their fruit flavors, but I've enjoyed every flavor I've had (black bottom, chocolate mint, chocolate coffee, carrot). Occasionally the cake in the other flavors will be a bit too moist; the cake won't hold its shape when I take off the wrapper. But that's only a bad thing if you're eating on the go. I would rather have a fall-apart delicious cupcake than a portable brick any day. All the way around though, Cupcake Cove seems to have it figured it out when it comes to cake to frosting ratio as well as cupcake transport. Those funny little plastic containers, while perhaps not particularly eco-friendly, do a good job of keeping your cupcake looking fine until you're ready to demolish it. I do, however, have one bone to pick with Cupcake Cove, how can you be called Cupcake COVE and not take advantage of the pirate associations?! When I first heard the name I pictured pink pirate ships hauling glittery treasure chests of sweet booty... not Helvetica font and a minimalist cupcake silhouette. Just think of all the marketing possibilities they are wasting!
author: Hallie R.

description: Holy Cow!!  This place is amazing.  I had the peanut butter cupcake, and I am in serious trouble, I want another one!  The cake part was moist, soft, the perfect balance between fluffy and dense.  The frosting was out of this world.  Slightly sweet, very peanutty with a few chocolate sprinkles on top.  Perfect afternoon treat.  At $3.00 they are a good deal and I will so be back (much to my dieting goals dismay).
author: Jennifer W.

description: Yum!!! I was rushing to get lunch, but happily made a detour into this shop once I saw it out of the corner of my eye. Teeny-tiny shop, but packed full with delicious cupcakes. I dont think they are pricey at all--as another reviewer noted, $3 is the going rate for a gourmet cupcake (e.g., Teacake, Sellers Market, Plant). And I'm happy to pay it when it's good!
author: brewgirl b.

description: Honestly, the chocolate mint cupcake was perfect. I usually think cupcakes are just over-priced mini-cakes, but I love chocolate mint and this cupcake had perfect sweetness, mintiness, moistness, and best of all, wonderfully textured frosting.
author: A P.

description:
this place is always busy and they sell out of cupcakes fast so come and get yours asap. the staff is friendly and the cupcakes are delicious.

red velvet and chocolate are my favorite. also buy 3 and get 1 free...so worth it for $3 each. 

they also have cookies too and my fav is the chocolate chip
author: Karen H.

description: I work around this area but did not notice the new cupcake shop until today. I am a cupcake fiend. Anywhere I go I see cupcakes I try it. These cupcakes were pretty good. The red velvet was great and so was the peanut butter cupcakes. The coffee chocolate and the mint chocolate were good but the vanilla was a tad sweet. The cupcakes were moist. Overall great cupcakes much better than Kara's and Sprinkles cupcakes. Thumbs up, I will be back.
author: Kris K.

description:
I was really torn between the 1 or 2 stars for this place.  In the end, the cream cheese frosting on the red velvet won the extra star.

Honestly, I had high hopes for this place.  You gotta figure, a place that exclusively focuses on perfecting cupcakes has to be pretty decent, eh?  Wrong.  

I get it....rents expensive in the FiDi, so you have to charge $3/cupcake.  But its not cool to be a total rip off.  

I ordered 1 red velvet and 1 lemon cream and was wholly unimpressed.  To start, the cupcakes were DRY.....like "I need to swish water to get these suckers to go down the pipe" type of dry.  The red velvet had a nice cream cheese frosting, but the "cake" was unimpressive....next to no flavor....which, had it been moist, still wouldn't have saved it.  

As for the lemon. *shudders* YUCK-O-LA.  It was just gross...like so disgusting that I chucked my $3 cupcake after 1 bite.  It was dry, no flavor beyond sour, and the frosting was just horrendous.  Sickeningly sweet with weird, fake lemon extract overtones.  

I shant be revisiting this place.  Shame, too, b/c the FiDi doesn't have another option for cupcakes other than SBucks.
author: Jax L.

description: Based on it's location I guess I was expecting a lot more from this place.  But maybe because I went there late in the day so there wasn't much selection and the cupcakes were probably sitting out for most of the day so the cakes were that moist.  The cake tasted like the texture of cornbread instead of a cupcake and the flavors were a bit deceiving.  I ordered a coffee cupcake and a coconut cupcake.  I was expecting the cake to be "coffee" flavored cake and the "coconut" to be a coconut flavored cake, but both were just a vanilla cupcake covered in the flavored buttercream frosting.  Maybe I wouldn't invested in buying those cupcakes if there was a better description of the actual flavor of the cupcake. All in all both cupcakes were disappointing - but then again I think I had too much expectations on the cupcakes to start with.  Will I try this place again, probably not.  But if you're in need of a cupcake in the financial district, that does seem like a convenient place to grab one to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Michelle F.

description: Unreal!  I've ordered their cupcakes for our monthly birthday celebration (5-6 doz at a time) two times now and everyone goes absolutely nuts.  First of all, the staff is great and they deliver them for us (even though they technically don't deliver) - the cupcakes are amazing!  The red velvet is to die for, but today I didn't get one of those soon enough so opted for the chocolate with white frosting...it was like eating a hostess cupcake - yum!  Highly recommend them and will be using them again and again. :)
author: Kim A.

description: I give cupcake cove one star because  the cup cake are dry like corn bread and the icying is toooo sweet! the only cupcake that was good  was carrrot cake i tryed every cupcake i got these cup cake for my birthday i also like the hello kitty on my cupcakes but other than that the cupcakes sucked the people are nice that work there but they need to learn how to make cupcake. BUT PEOPLE TRY THESE CUPCAKES FOR YOUR SELF! AND PS DONT YOU HATE DRY PEANUT BUTTER CUPCAKES!
author: Tashana h.

description: Just as good as it gets!!  I heard they were amazing and so had to try a few.  Frosting was perfect.  Not to greasy or too stiff.  Cake was nice and moist without being sticky.  Found a new fav in the city.
author: SF M.

description:
You can't put red food coloring into vanilla cupcake batter and call it red velvet. That is some bullshit shenanigans right there. Red velvet cupcakes are supposed to taste like a. chocolate and b. buttermilk-- smooth and rich and tangy. This red velvet cupcake tasted like neither of those things. The frosting was at least cream cheese, though a bit gummy-- not a pleasant texture at all. For the size, three dollars is quite a hit to my wallet. 

What saved this review from being two stars is the adorable little to go box they give you for the cupcakes and the pleasant woman at the counter. Would I go there again? Probably not. There are plenty of other awesome places to get a sweets fix in the FiDi that feel a lot more worth your money.
author: R E.

description: Wednesday, April 13, 2011 - approx. 1:15pm - I went there to taste their cupcakes as I was planning to order 3 dozens for a seminar at work. The red velvet was nice and tasty. The downfall is the rude woman at the cash register. There was one customer buying four cupcakes and three people were taking care of that one customer while chatting away.  I was ignored for at least 2 mins.  When another customer got in line behind me, she looked up and asked the woman, "who's next?  How rude!    People like this woman shouldn't be behind a counter.  I went back to my office and ordered 3 dozen cupcakes at Kara's.  My 1 star is for the lack of basic courtesy.
author: Etna B.

description:
After walking by this place a number of times after work, I finally gave them a try today.  I am sad to say that I would rank them as slightly better than something from a WalMart/Costco bakery, where a dozen cupcakes may be purchased for the price of one of these equivalents.  The cakes tasted like they were made from a box and the icing was uber sweet. I say they are slightly better because of the presentation--the icing is not just plopped on top.  Not terrible, but for $3, I want a great cupcake; not a dozen lame ones.  

Needless to say, I will not be gong back.

Perhaps, as other reviewers have said, some of the cupcakes are better than others.  All of them, however, cost the same, so I would expect them all to be worth $3.  I am surprised to see so many 5 stars for this place; I wonder if any of these reviewers have ever tried a cupcake anywhere else.

There are cupcake shops out there that have skilled artisans who actually make cupcakes that are worth $3 or more.  Kara's Cupcakes comes to mind.  There are also cupcake shops that are taking advantage of the reputations and goodwill developed by these quality shops and are selling crap for the same price.  Unfortunately, I see this place as being the latter.  

I am not sure why so many reviewers talk about the convenient location.  Sure, it is convenient, but is that what I consider when deciding to buy a cupcake?  No.  When you look it up on Yelp, you are given the address and a map, which is all I need to know if it is convenient for me.  Starbucks is convenient too, and they have better cupcakes.
author: C G K.

description: Peanut butter and chocolate cupcake. Need I say more.
author: Gary W.

description: Great job Cupcake Cove! Your red velvet cupcake was awesome. I'll be back for my next office sweets order!
author: Chad B.

description: Great cupcakes! Nice staff! Speedy service. Convenient. Prices are fair.
author: l m.

description: Red velvet here is a MUST TRY! Frosting just melts in your mouth, the chocolate with the mint frosting tastes like the ITS IT ice cream sandwhich YUMM! They gave me free samples because they just opened and the staff was REALLY FRIENDLY and welcoming! You should buy a single cupcake and get a To-Go box, SUPER cute box, you won't be disappointed. Will be going again !!
author: irene l.

description: Tried 3 cupcakes today from here. The lemon, strawberry and chocolate. All of these cupcakes were extremely dry and the frosting was too sweet. The chocolate one was the worst of the 3. It had a very distinct burnt taste to it, and the frosting was indelible. All of the cupcakes we tried were thrown into the garbage, where we felt they belonged. Absolutely terrible. I was told to try cupkate's next time I am in the area, and I will. You honestly could not pay me to eat these crappy cupcakes.
author: Kim S.

description: I went to Cupcake Cove to purchase some cupcakes for my son's 24th bday.  He & his friends love cupcakes.  The 2 young woman at the counter are very friendly, helpful.  They both greeted me right away. The place is a very cute, tiny storefront.  It happened to be a 'special' day for buy 5 get 1 free, which is great as they are $3/each. Either way, it is easy to buy 6.  There is an excellent flavor variety, even when I went at 4:00pm. The ladies helped me pick out 6 that were colorful.  I purchased the red velvet - excellent, cream cheese icing was perfect; lemon/lemon; pineapple; guava/passion fruit; chocolate; & salted caramel.  The cupcakes are normal sized but decorated like a bday cake.  It was perfect for the evening.  If they had mini-cupcakes I probably would go every day.  Their cupcakes are very cute, delicious, very moist, not too sweet, nicely decorated, & good variety.  They were a hit at dinner; nothing left but the cupcake paper!
author: Pam R.

description: Yummy cupcakes! not dry and frostings not tooooo sweet, just the way i like it. The red velvet was my favorite, however they made it super bright red as i'm use to red velvet being more of that deeper red.
author: JeNny C.

description:
Had to run out and buy 2 dozen cupcakes on the fly for an office birthday and used it as an opportunity to try the new spot.  Absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend.  The cake portion of all the cupcakes were moist which is key to a great cupcake.  

I purchased Red Velvet, Chocolate Chocolate, Vanilla Vanilla Vanilla Chocolate, Chocolate Vanilla & Peanut Butter,
author: Diana C.

description: dude $3 for a cupcake...... $3!?!?!?! are you kidding???? Whoa if I'm paying 3 bucks for a cupcake it'd better be the size of a muffin.... It was deffinately better than most, but $3 for an average size cupcake you could get at safeway for 75 cents isn't my cup of tea.
author: josh m.

description: I wanted to love these, but they were what I expected, way too sweet for most adults I think - most American pastries and cakes are. My wife and I thought the icing on top of the carrot cake was overpowering.  Prefer Kei Co in JapanTown. Tried them three times now and have not been disappointed.
author: Scott B.

description: Good cupcakes and nice looking lady's working there well be back soon.
author: James g.

description: The people of Cupcake Cove were kind enough to let me try all their flavors before I narrow down my favorites for my upcoming wedding order. My order was ready on time/super easy to pick up and the cupcakes were delicious! The most stressful part is picking only 4 flavors out of the 18 choices. So far I love the coconut and the lemon/vanilla. I'm seriously impressed with the service I received thus far and look forward to having my guests try their cupcakes too.
author: katrina t.

description: OMG I just stumbled across this little gem today!! Its my birthday and every 40yr old woman trying not to have a nervouse breakdown about being middle age needs a little black bottom cupcake in her life!! The cupcakes are super delicious and the gentleman that helped me was super friendly!!
author: Hmmmmmm N.

description: Although it annoys me that yet ANOTHER cupcake place has popped up in SF where it seems there are too many already, I was craving a little something sweet and found myself right in front of Cupcake Cove. The decor is nothing special. The cupcakes on the other hand are DELICIOUS! I'm a big fan of  the basics--vanilla and chocolate. The cupcakes I got were very moist, not TOO sweet -- just perfect. I will definitely stop by this place again and again...and again. YUM!
author: Sam L.

description: So at first I really didn't trust trying this place because it was so new in FiDi, but after I tried their passion fruit and guava cupcake, this will be the spot I hit up every time I need a mid-day pick up.  I love how they make it easy for you to take out in their little cupcake holders.  I would definitely recommend it to all my cupcake loving coworkers.
author: Michelle T.

description: is it just me or is there just too much hype regarding cupcakes. they are 3 bites of underated fat/calories and are going to live on in your body for at least a month. No Thanks! for the same # of calories you can have a lite meal that is actually tasty and leaves you satisfied for  the day. What the heck are you thinking??!!
author: Lori L.

description: As mentioned by others $3 for a cupcake that is a bit small. Overall the cupcake was just way too sweet for my tastes (even after I slashed off 95% of the buttercream frosting...)
author: Jeannette L.

description: They're good, but not great. Presentation is a 5. They're cute and colorful. Taste is a 3. Icing is way too much, and the cake itself is small and ever so slightly dry. But for downtown, when it's a coworker's birthday for example, this place is perfect.
author: sandy a.

description: The cupcake Cove is a cute idea and a perfect place for a sweet treat in the financial district. I tried the Red Velvet and the Peanut Butter. The red velvet is enjoyable but there was no cocoa in the cake. Their base must be a white cake making it a very bright red instead of the nice deep red when it's a cocoa base. The red velvet cup cakes at Starbucks are better only unfortunately smaller in size. The peanut butter was a moist chocolate w/peanut butter frosting. I learned that most of their cupcakes are basically chocolate or vanilla with different flavors in the frosting. I'd like to see them expand to different flavors of cake as well.
author: Michelle V.

description: Small overpriced cupcakes. For that price at least offer a decent size. The frosting was a bit dry around the edges. Nothing special, same stuff I make at home... The red velvet was good tho and co-workers were happy overall...
author: Trina K.

description: You're better off walking down the street to Walgreen's and buying a Just Desserts, single cupcake, in a nice package for $1.99.  I, along w/ several of my co-workers predict this place will be closed in a month.  $3.00 for a smaller than average cupcake that's just not very tasty?!!  I think not!
author: K. R.

description: standard good cupcake. used the scoutmob for a pretty good deal (on top of the buy 5 get 1 free). red velvet was delicious, wasn't too impressed with black bottom, and vanilla coffee was good as well. i'll be back
author: Lia A.

description: stopped by to try this place out, price is not bad.  $3, but if you get 5, you get 1 free.  cupcakes were soft and moist and alot of frosting which i like but it's a bit too sweet.  if they tone it down a bit, it would be perfect.
author: Food Is L.

description: i'm updating a previous review for this place. i knocked some stars off because the customer service has been horrible the last few times i've been. they are supposed to be open at 11am and the times i've tried going around 11, they weren't open yet. the other day, i needed to get cupcakes for the office and we had lunch being delivered at 11:30. i had to be back to sign for it so i went to cupcake cove at 11am. i stood around for 15 minutes and finally had to give up. i tried calling at 11:30 thinking i could run over there before lunch was served but nobody answered the phone. the rudest part was that there were 2 bakers in there and they saw me waiting outside and didn't even try to communicate with me about when they would be open. they completely ignored me. other people came up to get cupcakes during that time and walked away because the place was closed. so to the owners of cupcake cove- if you can't be open by 11am then change your hours. honestly that's not even early in the morning so there's no excuse to be late. you lost a pretty big sale on monday. i'm not sure if i'll be back which is a shame because i really like the cupcakes. it's just not worth the bad service.
author: susie r.
